He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy chicks to enable him to start poultry farming. His business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy chicks to enable him to start poultry farming

loans.name: Turdinisa

texts.ru: Турдиниса, 60 лет, замужем. Имеет 3 детей. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Турдиниса много лет занимается торговлей мужской одеждой на центральном рынке города. Бизнес она начала в 2000 году, на сегодняшний день он развит и приносит около 30,000 сом (KGS) прибыли в месяц. Всю прибыль от бизнеса Турдиниса старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение торговой точки. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для увеличения ассортимента товара. Турдиниса хочет развить свой бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Turdinisa is 60 years old and married. She has three children. The family is very friendly and respected in the village. Turdinisa has been selling men's clothes at the central market in town for many years. She started the business in 2000, and today it is well developed and fetches a profit of about 30,000 som (KGS) per month. Turdinisa tries to save all of the profits from the business towards expanding her retail outlet. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy clothing to increase her product range. Turdinisa wants to develop her business and save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale in order to increase the product range in her shop.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona dedicada a trabajar para lograr cubrir las necesidades de su grupo familiar, tiene como negocio una venta de ropa para ambos sexos, lo realiza en las afueras del mercado municipal, lo emprendió hace tres años; comparte su vivienda con su esposa y 4 hijos, todos sus hijos asisten a la escuela.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar prendas de vestir como vestidos, pantalones, chores, camisas, etc., tendrá un inventario renovado con lo que sus clientes necesiten, la finalidad de la inversión es tener un negocio competitivo que le genere las ganancias suficientes para cumplir con todos sus compromisos.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener con vida su fuente de ingresos, cancelar su deuda y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a man who is devoted to working in order to provide for his family.  He operates a clothing store that serves both men and women.  His store is located outside of the town market, and he started it three years ago.  He lives with his wife and his four children, who are all in school.

He is seeking this loan to purchase clothing such as: dresses, pants, shorts, shirts, etc. This will allow him to have an updated inventory with the items that his customers need.  The goal of this investment is to build a competitive business that will generate enough money to fulfill all of his commitments.  His dreams are to keep his business alive, pay off his debts and to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: purchase clothing such as: dresses, pants, shorts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rodelyn is 33 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Rodelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rodelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Rodelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures farming rice.

Amparo dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Almira works very hard to provide for them.

Almira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereals, candies, etc. to sell.

Almira has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereals, candies, etc. 

In the future, Almira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereals, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 46 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 2 years now.

Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 45 years old and has four children. Annabelle is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Annabelle has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines.

Felicita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Felicita has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 47 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nenita has been farming rice for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith works hard to support her family. Bernadith is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Bernadith requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional cloth, yard, needle, and thread for and to maintain her sewing machine.

Bernadith has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, yard, needle, and thread for and to maintain her sewing machine

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, tiene una edad de 27 años de edad, actualmente vive con su madre de 45 años de edad, su actividad económica es administrar una venta de productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días y sin un horario fijo, su negocio lo tiene desde hace cinco años.
Tiene como proyecto mejorar el negocio y está necesitando de un crédito para invertirlo en granos básicos, azúcar, sal, gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, harina, etc., su nuevo inventario le permitirá atender las necesidades de sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más rentable y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 27 and currently lives with his mother, who is 45. His economic activity is running a basic necessities shop, which he has had for five years. He works everyday without a fixed schedule.

His project is to improve the business. He needs a loan to invest in basic grains, sugar, salt, fizzy drinks, juices, snacks, flour, etc. His new stock will allow him to meet the needs of his customers and increase his profits. His aspirations are having a more profitable business and keeping his family going.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, sugar, salt, fizzy drinks, juices, snacks, flour, etc. His new stock will allow him to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two washing machines and expand her capacity due to the growing demand.

loans.name: Bualima

texts.ru: Буалима, 44 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование - среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2005 году. Благодаря упорному труду Буалимы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Буалима планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Bualima is 44 years old, married and has two children. She has a secondary education. She rears animals to get income for her family, having started in 2005. Thanks to Bualima's hard work, she now has six cows. In order to develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow to increase her herd. Bualima plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase her herd.

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en:
Sohiba is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988 and is now living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. She and her husband work in agriculture and support each other in their activities. They have three heads of livestock and bought two more for breeding from them, for further selling. 

They also have land where they plant agricultural products such as potatoes and wheat.  In the future she wants to make a better business and an improved standard of living. For the upcoming season she wants to buy potato seeds and plant new crops.  She asked for a 8000 TJS loan to buy potato seeds. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and plant new crops to have more income so as to live better

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en: Sabohat is a wise woman. She was born in Tajikistan in 1959. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has eight children. The area where she lives has preferable conditions to do business in agriculture, such as keeping livestock and planting crops. Her family lives on income that is earned from agriculture and planting crops. Her son helps her parents and each season goes to Russia to earn money to help her parent’s business. This year after the collapse of the economy her son could not find a job and earn money in Russia. She had to apply to IMON and KIVA lenders to ask a loan to buy seeds of potato and to spend on family needs. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders in her hard period of life. There were difficulties and challenges when she raised her children. She tries to help her husband and ensure her children have necessary things. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds of potato and to spend on family needs

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 39 years old and married with three children.  Three children are still in school, Mila works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Mila has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 53 years old and married with seven children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Felomina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Felomina has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from buy and sell of recycled materials.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 70 years old and widowed with 11 children. 

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like coffee, chips, egg, milk, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, chips, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. One child is in school.

Sonia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has an oyster-farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Sonia requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional binder, bamboo and other equipment for her oyster farm.

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional binder, bamboo and other equipment for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Rene Alberto

texts.es:
Rene, de 50 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañado y junto a su pareja tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian y es por los cuales trabaja día a día. 

Rene, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, ya que fue lo que sus padres le enseñaron, así es como hoy en día es agricultor.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para sembrar granos básicos, ya que ya tiene preparada 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra y no le alcanzo el dinero.

Rene, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y seguir cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Rene, age 50, did not go to school.  He is in a common-law marriage, and along with his partner he has two children, who are in school and for whom he works day to day.

Rene has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old.  Since that is what his parents taught him, today he is a farmer.

He needs the money from the loan to buy compost, pesticides, and fertilizers to sow staple grains, since he has already prepared 14,000 square meters of land and he can’t afford it.

Rene’s dream is to see his children become working professionals and to keep cultivating his land.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, and fertilizer to sow basic grains.

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es:
El  señor  Milton  de 33  años de edad vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación donde cuenta con una pulpería en su negocio vende todo lo que es abarrotería y refrescos, sus clientes son todas las personas amigos  y  vecinos de su comunidad.
Don Milton es conocido por ser un hombre luchador, vive en el municipio de San Lorenzo en la parte sur de Honduras, está solicitando el préstamo  para la compra de cemento y ladrillos para realizarle unas mejoras a su vivienda y  también para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, etc. surtir más su negocio.  Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea poder salir adelante y seguir apoyando a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
Su sueño es terminar su casa y siempre tener surtido su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Mayo 2015.
texts.en:
Milton is 33 years old and lives with his wife in his house where he has a store. He sells all kinds of groceries and drinks in his business. His clients are friends and neighbors from his community. Milton is known to be a fighter. He lives in the municipality of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

He is requesting a loan to buy cement and bricks to make improvements on his house and also buy beans, rice, sugar, cafe, bread, etc. to stock his business. With his profits and the help of this loan he wants to get ahead and continue to support his family with the household expenses. His dream is to finish his house and always have his store well-stocked.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and beans, rice, sugar, cafe, bread, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Josel

texts.en:
Josel is 43 years old, married with two children.

Josel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Josel has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from E-Loading.

Josel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lourdes has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, se mantiene atendiendo la venta de ropa, con la ayuda de créditos está logrando superarse económicamente y cuenta con clientes satisfechos.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar vestido, faldas, camisas, ropa interior, etc.,  para resurtir el inventario de su negocio, de esta manera seguirá trabajando para subsistir y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en: Rodolfo supports himself by selling clothes. With the help of the loans, he is succeeding economically and has satisfied clients. Once again, he is requesting a loan to buy dresses, skirts, shirts, underwear, etc, to restock the inventory of his business. This way, he will continue working, getting by and paying off his debts.

loans.use: buy dresses, skirts, shirts, underwear, etc, to restock the inventory of his business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 44 year old, married woman with four children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Perla has a fishing business in the Philippines. Perla requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Perla has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment like fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

loans.name: Aylin

texts.en:
Aylin is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She works in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aylin has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Aylin requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elve

texts.en:
Elve is 31 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elve requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Misbah's Group

texts.en:
Misbah is the age of 39, living with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband provides a service of changing the seat covers of vehicles.  He purchases ready-made seat covers and stitches them as well.  His shop is situated in the vehicle workshop market. He has to pick up each customer one at a time and convince them to change the seat covers for their vehicle. He does not take much of the customer's time and quickly changes the seat covers. Earlier, he was providing this service only for motorbike seats, now he wants to provide the service for the various cars as well. For this purpose, he wants to buy various colors and types of rexine so that he can show his art at sewing car seats also.

Therefore, Misbah requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy various types of rexine for sewing and then selling vehicle seat covers. 

Misbah thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
 
Note: Misbah is in the red shawl in the picture.

loans.use: to buy various colors and types of rexine for her husband to sew vehicle seat covers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mason's tools for her husband's construction services.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Joyce works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and poultry.

Joyce is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. Joyce hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorena Margarita

texts.es:
Lorena, de 27 años de edad, está acompañada y vive junto a su esposo y su hija, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a hacer costuras y a la venta de productos de enchape, debido a la situación económica solo estudio hasta cuarto grado.

Lorena, tiene 10 años de trabajar como costurera y tiene 5 años de trabajar con productos de enchape, ya que de esa manera puede ganarse su salario para cubrir los gastos de la familia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar productos de enchape, ya que necesita invertir en mercadería porque sus clientes le están pidiendo productos. 
	
Lorena, desea aumentar su cartera de clientes y seguir ayudándole a su hija a estudiar y que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Lorena, age 27, is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and her daughter.  She works doing household chores, sewing, and selling plated jewelry.  Due to her economic situation, she only attended school through fourth grade. 

Lorena has been working as a seamstress for ten years, and has been working with plated jewelry for five years, since in this way she is able to earn a salary and cover family expenses.

She needs the loan to buy plated jewelry.  She needs to invest in merchandise because her customers are requesting products from her.

Lorena wants to increase her list of customers and continue helping her daughter go to school, so that she can become a working professional.

loans.use: to buy plated jewelry.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns income from selling vegetables. Rosemarie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rosela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Rosela has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns income from fish vending. Rosela aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married with three children and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Lucia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from E-Loading.

Lucia requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline and to pay for maintenance for her motorcycle. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline and to pay for maintenance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a weaving business in the Philippines. Leony has been in this business for 17 years now.

Leony requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Leonila..

texts.en:
Leonila, who is in her mid-50s is married and has four children, two of whom are grown-up and two of whom are still in college.  Leonila has been running two businesses, growing and selling chickens and selling milk, since 2002. 

This will be Leonila's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to raise layer chickens to sell eggs and fed her cows to sell more milk. Leonila has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is really doing fine with her loans and appreciates the support of Kiva lenders.  Leonila used her profits to pay college fees, for loan repayment, and to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy cow feed to get more milk from her cows and to buy chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of managing to pay her children's college fees.

Leonila will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy cow feed to get more milk from her cows and to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es: Marlin es una emprendedora Barranquillera de 36 años de edad que con escasos recursos económicos creó su propio proyecto productivo de confecciones, iniciativa que hoy le permite ganarse la vida demostrando que el crear empresa sin necesidad de tener un gran capital sí es posible. Hace seis años Marlin con su máquina casera y con mucha dedicación comenzó a coser  a los vecinos y familiares y hace aproximadamente un año un amigo le planteó la posibilidad de asociarse e incursionar en la confección de Bermudas de dril y Jeans para comercializarlas por lotes en establecimientos comerciales de Sincelejo, Corozal, Montería y otros municipios  de la Costa Caribe Colombiana. El éxito no se hizo esperar y en este momento aspira a llegar a consolidar una empresa más grande para lo cual está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que le permita invertir en la compra de telas, hilos e insumos, para incrementar su producción y la ampliación de  su mercado. El principal  reto para Marlin, es consolidar aún más su microempresa, con el propósito de devengar mayores ingresos para el beneficio económico de su familia.
texts.en: Marlin, age 36, is an entrepreneur from Barranquilla. With limited resources, she created her own productive clothing shop. This start-up now allows her the possibility to earn a living, helping her see that starting a business without lots of capital is possible. Six years ago Marlin started to sew for neighbors and friends using just her home sewing machine and her own dedication. Approximately one year ago, a friend suggested she join an association and venture into producing Bermuda shorts and jeans to sell in bulk to shops in Sincelejo, Corozal, Montería, and other cities along the Caribbean cost of Colombia. The level of success was greater than expected and she now aspires to create a larger business. For this reason, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It will allow her to invest in fabric, thread, and supplies to increase her production and enlarge her market. Marlin's greatest challenge is to strengthen her small business, with the goal of earning a larger income and benefit her family economically.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and supplies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 34 years old and married with three children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marivic has been in this business for six years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Betty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil, and personal care products to sell.

Betty has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns income from buying and selling animal feed. Betty aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil, and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en:
Grecilda works hard to support her family. Grecilda is married and has a buy and sell drinks business in the Philippines.

Grecilda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cases of drinks to sell.

Grecilda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of drinks to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 33 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marilou has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilou has been in this business for 5 years. Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Maribeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maribeth requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Maribeth has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Al Ikhewa Rachaya Group

texts.en:
Al Ikhewa Rachaya group consists of four hard working women, who put a great deal of effort in to developing their business, to increase their income and develop their own and families' living.  The four of them decided to join together and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and dear friends.

Saaeda is the group's featured borrower. She is a 46-year-old single successful multi tasking lady, who invests and gains from every minute in her life, to make sure she can benefit from a financially secured future, till the time she decides to retire. With a twenty five years of experience in her diversified domains, she proved to be very skilled and well known in her region.
Eight years ago she opened a convenience store where most of her villagers come and benefit from her competitive diversified products (food and beverages, gifts and gadgets, in addition to home products) and good prices.  At the same time, she works as a teacher in the village school, and after school she works as a tutor.

Since during the summer her villagers and nearby villages,  citizens plan for their wedding during the summer weather, she decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with gift items to get ready for the summer wedding season and to be able to respond to her expected customers' needs.

Saaeda is the lady standing at the far right side of the picture, as for the other group members, Manar is the second lady at the right, Maysoon is the first lady at the far left side of the picture, while Flexo is the second from the left.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with gift items to get ready to the summer weddings season in her region

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Don juan de 64 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y maicillo desde hace 35 años, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Él vive con su esposa y su hija, don Juan desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo ya que dentro de poco empieza la época de siembra, para ello solicita un crédito para invertir en: semillas, fertilizante y abono para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, age 64, learned how to work the land when he was very young, so he has worked for 35 years growing corn and sorghum.  With this work he is able to earn better economic income and give his family better living conditions.  He lives with his wife and daughter.  

Juan wants to invest in supplies for his crop since sowing season begins very soon.  For this, he is requesting a loan to invest in seeds, fertilizer, and compost to continue with his crop, with which he hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and compost.

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be friendly. He operates a photography and photocopy business, which he has been involved in for 6 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of better equipment. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy photography equipment. His business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will meet his family needs.

loans.use: to buy photography equipment for his business

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona works hard to support her family. Melitona is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melitona requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melitona has been in this business for 37 years now.

Melitona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41, a widow with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonida has a weaving business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Leonida has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Corazon is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy paint, welding rod, and other materials for the repair of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, welding rod, and other materials for the repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Melida

texts.en:
Melida works hard to support her family. Melida is married with six children and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Melida requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall.

Melida has been in this business for 1 year now, and also earns additional income from general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is married, 33 years old and has two children in school.

Ria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Ria has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Lea is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a selling fertilized duck embryo business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending and general store. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell to her customers for her selling fertilized duck embryo business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of balot (fertilized duck eggs) and fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is married and has three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, for her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable goods wilt, leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Jeanet

texts.en: Jeanet is a 31-year-old married woman, from Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. Recently, she accessed another loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 for additional working capital to buy a variety of grocery items and school supllies for her existing business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products as well as school supplies in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items and school supllies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feeds so as to increase the number of litres produced and supplied to clients daily

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 32 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer, new seeds, etc., for her farm.

Elisa has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, new seeds, etc for her farm of vegetables

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 51 years old and has six children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Belinda is in the aquaculture business, farming oysters in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional bamboo, binder and other materials to use for her oyster farm.

She has been farming oysters for four years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo, binder and other materials to use for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is thankful that he was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which he used to pay for a new vehicle. Through his earnings he is able to send his high school aged child to school and support his and his child's daily needs.

He would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan, which he will use to buy another funeral car to better serve the needs of his own funeral home. He earns at least 18,000 PHP a day for his services. He is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given to him from his earnings from his funeral home, which will surely help in his farmily's daily sustenance and fund his child's education.

Rodel hopes to maintain his current business but also aims to look for other means of income to uplift their quality of life. He wants a good college education for his child. Every week, he meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional service car to use in his funeral home.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 34-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and his two sons and two daughters. 

Khalil works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. He also has a rickshaw he uses to transfer goods between the wholesalers and traders. 

Khalil took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy products to distribute to the local traders. This will improve his productivity and also his income. Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy products to distribute to the local traders.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 27 years old, and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Joy has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Berta Maritza

texts.es:
Berta, es un apersona que elabora flores para vender y brinda el servicio de sastrería, su negocio lo tiene desde hace tres años y con el tiempo ha perfeccionado sus conocimientos y establecido una cartera clientes. Berta vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad.
Para aumentar su capacidad de venta requiere de un crédito para comprar papelería, alambre, pegamento, telas, botones, hilos, etc., con estos materiales elaborara flores y prendas de vestir para atender las demandas de sus clientes.
Sus sueños son ser propietaria de un negocio popular en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Berta is a person who makes flowers and provides tailoring services. She has had her business for three years and, over time, has refined her knowledge and established a list of clients.

To increase her sales ability, she needs a loan to buy paper, wire, glue, cloth, buttons, thread, etc. - materials she will use to make flowers and items of clothing to supply her clients' requirements.

Her dream is to be the proprietor of a popular business in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy paper, wire, glue, cloth, buttons, thread, etc. - materials she will use to make flowers and items of clothing to supply demand.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking mother who goes out in the streets to sell her food snacks for some money. She is very diligent and she works hard for her income. 

Anita applied for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), and she appreciates the programs and services of the cooperative. Anita is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase production of the food snacks that she makes and sells. 

She asked financial assistance from PMPC in the amount of PHP 10,000 and is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, Anita deeply wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase production of the food snacks that she makes and sells

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is a hard-working and diligent woman. She has never tired of working to earn a living, supporting her needs. Nicolasa is engaged in a snack vending business, selling pancakes. Her business is doing well and she spends her time perfecting her own pancake recipe. 

Nicolasa has maximized her profits and has kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has taken out another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her pancakes to serve more customers and be able to accept orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack recipe to increase sales to continuously benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her pancakes to serve more customers and be able to accept orders

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 64 years old, married to Teresa and supports four children. He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 27 years earning 15,000 KES per month. 

Moses applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to lease more land to expand his farming activity. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and start a stable retail business. His future hope is to earn a relatively higher income consistently.

loans.use: to lease more land to expand his farming activity.

loans.name: Dadeus

texts.en:
Dadeus is 28 years old, married and supports a family of three children. He has been selling clothing for the last five years earning 6,000 KES per month. 

Dadeus applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of clothing to sell so as to earn more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to start poultry farming in the area. His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad, a responsible mother, is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more assorted goods for her store. She wants to restock inventories of noodles, biscuits, sugar, milk and other sari-sari store items. This way, Caridad will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods for her store

loans.name: Noe De Jesus

texts.es:
Noé, de 39 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta bachillerato, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Noé, hace seis años trabajaba como policía de tránsito, pero debido a un accidente automovilístico donde tuvo problemas con sus miembros inferiores, le impidieron seguir laborando en esa institución, fue por esa que se dedicó al cultivo de maíz.

El dinero de este crédito lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizante, pesticida y pagar la mano de obra, entre otras cosas que necesita el cultivo de maíz.

El principal deseo de es lograr tener una buena cosecha de maíz.
texts.en:
Noé is 39 years old.  He managed to study until high school.  He lives with his two children, and his wife takes care of household duties.

Six years ago, Noé was working as a traffic policeman.  However, due to a car accident where he had problems with his lower limbs, he was prevented from continuing to work in this institution.  It was because of this that he dedicated himself to the cultivation of corn.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for labor, among other things needed to cultivate corn.

His main wish is to achieve a good corn harvest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is 52 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. He is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than 20 years. He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Arnold hopes to own another rice field to till.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Karen is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Karen has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Karen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу, 26 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее - среднее образование, 5 лет в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Канымбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Канымбу составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития и расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, она будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Kanymbu is 26, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education and has earned the main income for her family for five years by raising livestock. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has twenty sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to develop and expand her business, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy ten sheep to fatten and sell. She plans to invest her profits in the future development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

Ligaya sells purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of purified water to sell to customers.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Handomah

texts.en:
Handomah is a 21-year-old single lady. She has been running her accessories and perfume shop for five years to support her family in a well-managed way.

Handomah is working hard on developing her business through her previously acquired loans from Kiva Field Partner Al Majmoua. Her business is small and its income isn't enough to expand and increase her merchandise continuously. Acquiring loans proved to be a good plan towards increasing her merchandise and developing her business. 

Therefore, today she is acquiring another loan from Al Majmoua. This will be her forth loan cycle to continue her orthodontic process which she started to relieve several unknown aches. This time Handoma didn't invest her loan in increasing her business merchandise because she believes that her business is going on fine and her dental needs are a priority for her.

As an optimistic person, Handomah believes that when there is a will there is a way, and her dream to start wholesale trading will soon come true.

loans.use: to continue her with her orthodontic process which she started to relieve several unknown aches.

loans.name: Jessica Esmeralda

texts.es:
Jessica, es una joven que se dedica a vender productos de belleza y otros artículos por medio de catálogo, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años y se motivó a fundarlo para tener recursos económicos con los que cubre sus compromisos; ella vive con su hija y sus dos hermanos de 4, 13 y 15 años de edad respectivamente.
El capital le será de ayuda para comprar lociones, cremas corporales, labiales, polvos, mascarillas, entre otros productos que son necesarios para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, espera atender mejor a sus clientes y que las ventas sean mayores.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y brindar mejores cuidados a su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young woman who sells beauty products and other items through a catalog. She has had the business for 3 years and was motivated to found it to have economic resources, with which she meets her commitments. She lives with her daughter and her two brothers of 4, 13, and 15 years old respectively.

The money will be helpful to her to buy lotions, body creams, lipsticks, powder, and masks, among other products that are needed to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to better serve her customers and that sales become higher. Her dreams are to have a bigger business and provide better care for her family.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body creams, lipsticks, powder, and masks, among other products.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 51 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He has had a retail shop and has been running it for 15 years now.

He will be using the loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil, and soap detergents to sell and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to expand his retail shop and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods and products, such as sugar and cooking oil, for sale in his retail shop and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: Jose de 40  años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y maicillo, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y luego la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose, 40 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. He has worked for the last 15 years in agriculture cultivating corn, beans, and sorghum. When his harvest is ready, he collects it in the silos shown in the photo, and later he sells it in neighboring towns. He already has many regular customers. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, etc. in order to be able to continue with his crops, since that is his only source of work, and in that way have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Ana Esmeralda

texts.es: Ana de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos  una niña de 4 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ana presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 6 años de manera domiciliar, actividad que le permite aportar a su familia con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Ana desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera proteger a su familia de las inclemencias del tiempo.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, lives in her own house with her life partner and her two children, a four-year-old girl and a seven-year-old boy.  Ana has provided home housekeeping services for six years, which allows her to help with the family's household expenses.

Ana wants a new roof for her house, because the current roof has deteriorated.  That's why she's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal roofing, wood, nails, and wire to fix the roof and protect her family from inclement weather.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal roofing, wood, nails, and wire to put a new roof on her house

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Fides is in her late 40s and is a widow with seven children. Four of her children are still in school and three are grown up. 

Fides has been running two projects. One is a school shop where she sells bites to school children and the other is selling tap water. She has been in this business for six years. She works from 6 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Fides' fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy the fast-moving bites that the kids like most, like biscuits, crisps, mandazi, vitumbua, sweets, baobab seeds, juice, etc. She also bought and filled her tanks for selling tap water and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy water for her tank to sell tap water and to increase bites at the school shop.

loans.name: Ma. Hermalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Hermalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Ma. Hermalyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela de 21 años es una joven apasionada por el diseño y la confección, aprendió este arte junto a su madre quien es confeccionista y le enseño detalle a detalle cada una de las técnicas de corte y costura.  Siendo una profesional en este arte en el año 2013 decidió aperturar su taller de confecciones, en que hoy día cuenta con un gran número de clientes a quien confecciona prendas de vestir con novedosos diseños a su medida, garantizando un servicio y materiales de alta calidad.  Ella evidencio en sus confecciones una oportunidad de mejora en su capacidad de producción y acabados de prendas, decidió conseguir los recursos para ello está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que adquirirá una maquina industrial y así continuar manteniendo los estándares de calidad. Ella es madre de una bebe de dos meses de nacida a quien desea ofrecerle bienestar fruto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Manuela, 21 years old, is a young person who is passionate about design and dressmaking. She learned this art together with her mother, who is a dressmaker and taught her detail by detail each of the cutting and sewing techniques.

Being a professional of this art, in 2013 she decided to open her dressmaking shop, in which today she has a great number of customers who she makes clothing for with new designs at their measurements, guaranteeing high quality service and materials.

She demonstrated an opportunity to improve her production capacity and finished garments in her dressmaking, and decided to find resources for it. She is applying for her first credikiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy an industrial machine, and in that way continue maintaining standards of quality. She is the mother of a two-month-old baby, who she wants to provide for through her work.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is an old lady, aged 55, and is a mother of four sons and four daughters. Her son, from a very early age, has been very hardworking and has always helped his mother as far as he could. He has been running a general store for about five years, but then all his savings were spent on his sister’s wedding.

Therefore, Parveen applied for a loan to buy the required inventory to run the family's day-to-day expenses. Parveen is thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 43-year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who has worked hard for 26 years as a car mechanic to provide his family with the necessary standards of living, and to make sure they can benefit from a shining future. One that is better than what he experienced during his time as a child, teenager and developing his business.

In 2006, Mohamad established his current garage where he welcomes his customers in a very special way and makes sure that they get what they need in a very short period of time. Since technology and cars are developing quickly, Mohamad is working hard to stay up to date with every new released car, and related technology. 

His family responsibilities, especially his children's school expenses, limit his ambitions. Nevertheless, his faith in an acquired loan from Kiva's Field Partner Al Mjamoua brought to him a dream come true. He took his first step forward towards buying necessary tools and machines to develop his business with the previous two acquired loans. His current acquired loan will be invested in the same purpose. He is working hard to move his current business to a bigger place so he can accept more cars at the same time.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and machines to develop his business.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yessenia, está solicitando un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que estos le dan en su negocio y en vista del aumento del número de clientes, en esta oportunidad lo necesita para comprar maíz, leña y una plancha más grande para elaborar la venta de tortillas, su objetivo es mantener la continuidad de su negocio y aumentar la productividad.
Para Yessenia el préstamo anterior le ha sido de ayuda para mantenerse trabajando y obteniendo mejores ganancias que está utilizando en la construcción de una pequeña vivienda de láminas, su familia tiene el mismo número de miembros y todos se encuentran saludables.
texts.en:
Yessenia is requesting a new loan because of the good results they give her business. And, in light of the increase in her number of customers, she needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, and a larger griddle to make and sell tortillas. The objective is to maintain the continuity of her business and increase productivity.

For Yessenia, the previous loan has been helpful in keeping her working and in obtaining better earnings, which she is using to build a small house of corrugated metal. Her family has the same number of members and they are all healthy.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and a larger griddle to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en:
Sharaf is a 25-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Sharaf has a car that he uses to transfer goods between the wholesalers and traders.

Sharaf took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy products to distribute to the local traders. This will improve his productivity and also his income.

Sharaf appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy products to distribute to the local traders.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena de 68 años de edad es soltera no  tiene hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 22 años  a la venta de tortillas. 
Doña Magdalena sus venta son de forma ambulante en un mercado de San Lorenzo, también vende en su casa es una mujer trabajadora que ha luchado toda su vida para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus hijos los cuales ya están grandes.
Doña Magdalena está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y varias, etc. para realizarle unas mejoras a su vivienda  porque desea terminar de construir un baño para su casa con el apoyo del préstamo espera seguir mejorando su vivienda y su calidad de vida, es su sexto crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 68 years old, is single and does not have children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. She has her own home and has worked for the last 22 years selling tortillas.

Magdalena carries out her sales as a street vendor in a market in San Lorenzo. She also sells from her home. She is a hardworking woman who has fought her whole life to get ahead and to be able to help her children, who are now grown.

Magdalena is requesting the loan to buy bricks, cement, rebar, etc. to carry out some improvements to her home because she hopes to finish construction of a bathroom for her house. With the support of the loan, she hopes to continue improving her home and her quality of life. It is the sixth loan she has requested from Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2015

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, rebar, etc. for her home.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en: Zulhumor is a precocious woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an emigrant. When her husband went abroad to earn money, she decided to learn how to sew and be a tailor to feed her family. She started to sew traditional women's dresses at home. Then she settled into sewing fabric and recently has three students who are learning how to sew from her. She is asking for financial support to buy a sewing machine to make her work efficiently. She already attracts customers and sews Tajik national dresses for brides.  She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make her work efficiently

loans.name: Efrai

texts.es: Efraín es un hombre trabajador de 57 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos una niña de 18 años y un varón de 16 años de edad. Efraín es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 46 años a la agricultura, ya que desde joven apoyaba a su padre con estos trabajados, en lo que se ha apoyado para sacar adelante a su familia. Efraín desea construir un cuarto en su propiedad, ya que actualmente su vivienda es de bajareque y con cada lluvia se deteriora más, por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su propiedad que le permita ir mejorando poco a poco su la misma.
texts.en:
Efraín is a hard working man of 57 who lives with his wife and 2 children, a 18-year-old daughter and a 16-year-old son. Efraín has been working in agriculture for 46 years, as since little he has helped his father with this work. This has helped him to get ahead with his family.

Efraín wishes to build a room in his property, since currently his house is made of mud walls, and with every rain it deteriorates more. For this, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in cement, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room in his property, which will allow him to improve the house little by little by himself.

loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room in his property

loans.name: Praxeda..

texts.en:
Praxeda, who is in her late forties, is a widow with three children; two are grown up, and one is still at school. She has been running two projects, a retail shop and a grocery store, for ten years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Praxeda's thirteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and opened a grocery store. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built her own house, and covered loan repayment and household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase the grocery stock, especially the fast-moving drinks, and to increase the shop inventory. She dreams of extending her business and to start selling food in her grocery.

Praxeda will make sure she pays back all her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase the grocery stock, especially the fast-moving drinks, and to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Hugo Adiel

texts.es:
Hugo, es una persona que gusta mucho de trabajar en el campo cultivando maíz y frijol, es soltero, vive con su abuela, no tiene hijos ni familiares en el extranjero; el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de su familia, cuenta con mucha experiencia en desempeñar los trabajos agrícolas, tiene un horario de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde, su propio negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años.
Invertirá en abono, insecticidas y plaguicidas, para sembrar maíz y frijol, así mejorará sus cosechas, espera tener una mayor cantidad de granos básicos para abastecer a su familia con alimento y comercializar otra parte para mejorar su situación financiera.
Los sueños de Hugo son comprar ganado, vender lácteos y tenar casa propia.
texts.en:
Hugo is a person who really likes working in the field growing corn and beans. He is single and lives with his grandmother. He does not have children or family members abroad. He learned the profession with the help of his family. He has a lot of experience in carrying out agricultural work. His schedule is from 6:00am to 1:00pm. He has had his own business for the last 10 years.

He will invest in fertilizer, insecticide, and pest control to plant corn and beans, and in that way he will improve his harvests. He hopes to have a greater quantity of basic grains to supply his family with food, and then sell the other part to improve his financial situation.

Hugo’s dreams are to buy cattle, sell dairy products, and have his own home.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, insecticide, and pest control to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Mule

texts.en:
Mule is married with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Though she is determined to make her home happy, she looks at weather changes letting her down regarding her cocoa production. Her vision is having a fully stocked cocoa store to earn extra income and care for her children like a loving parent. 

Mule has asked for a loan to rent a cocoa garden to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent a cocoa garden to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from a cafeteria.

Cristina aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She has vocational education; she graduated from city trading college, and for several years she worked in the trading field.

Now, with her husband, she is running farming on their cute farm; here she has cows, calves, heifers, and chickens. As her customers mention, she makes the sweetest macun (national dairy product) from her farm milk, the tastiest cheese, and also very good curd, and she also sells some meat.

Zhanna has a lot of customers for her farm products, but the milk that her cows give is not enough for making more of them. She asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of two more cows for her farm. She is sure that this purchase will justify her expectations of more income.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows for her farm.

loans.name: Minelda Aricela

texts.es:
La señora MInelda de 31  años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en una aldea de Nacaome al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio  de venta de ropa usada.
Doña Minelda vende de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonia de San Lorenzo y Nacaome es una mujer muy dedicada a su negocio y está  ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de  lamina zinc, cemento y arenilla para realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, con apoyo del préstamo desea lograr su objetivo que es bien acondicionada su casa.
Uno de sus sueños es  hacer crecer más en su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Ms. Minelda of 31 years lives with her two children and her husband in the village of Nacaome in the South of Honduras. For many years she has worked in the business of used clothing sales. Ms. Minela sells as a street vendor in the neighborhoods and towns of San Lorenzo and Nacaome.

She is a woman who is very dedicated to her business, and this time she is requesting for a loan to purchase zinc metal sheets, cement and sand to make improvements to her house. With the help of the loan, she wants to achieve her goal of upgrading her house. 

One of her dreams is to grow her business.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  May 2015.

loans.use: to purchase zinc metal sheets, cement and sand for her house

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans, 37 years old, is married to Sarange and supports three children who are 8, 6, and 3 years old. He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 15 years, earning KES 13,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops and improve production. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hope is to earn a relatively higher income regularly.

loans.use: To purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops and improve production

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is 43 years old and she lives with her nice family in Varser village in the Gegharkunik region. As she says, being born in a peasant family, she got married and very quickly became the best partner for her husband in farming and agriculture and since then until today, they do everything about their farm together. On the farm, Svetlana takes care of cows, calves, heifers, sheep, lambs and a lot of chickens. On her plot of land, she cultivates potatoes, cabbage, carrots, beans, greens and also sunflowers.  She sells all her farm products from her farm and at the wholesale market. Svetlana has a son who is going into the army for service. This loan will help Svetlana to buy fodder for her farm cattle, potato seedlings, and fertilizer and also diesel fuel for her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm cattle, potato seedlings, and fertilizer and also diesel fuel for her agricultural activities

loans.name: Anonymous
