loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her house and in this way protect her children.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo e hijos, todos comparten un ambiente familiar estable; es propietaria de una panadería desde hace 8 años, la fundo por iniciativa propia y con el transcurso del tiempo ha obtenido más experiencia y lo comprueba con la preferencia de sus clientes, toda la familia trabaja en el negocio y no tiene  ayuda económica del extranjero.
Invertirá en harinas, huevos, azúcar, sal, levadura, manteca, etc., contará con materia prima con  la que elaborara la venta de pan, pretende tener una mayor producción y variedad de pan a la disponibilidad de sus clientes, espera mejorar el servicio e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
Sus sueños son mantener una imagen de una persona responsable y honesta en su comunidad, mantener su negocio en el mercado, cubrir las necesidades familiares y apoyar a sus hijos para que se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and children, who all share a stable family environment. 

She has been the owner of a bakery for 8 years, which she founded out of her own initiative. With the passage of time, she has obtained greater experience which can be proven by the preference of her customers. All of her family works in this business, and they do not have external financial help.

She will invest in flour, eggs, sugar, salt, yeast, lard, etc., that will count as ingredients for the bread that she sells. She intends to have a greater production and variety of bread at the availability of her customers. She hopes to improve the services and to increase her economic income. 

Her dreams are to maintain the image of a person who is responsible and honest her community, maintain her business in market, cover the needs of the family, and support her children improve academically.

loans.use: to invest in flour, eggs, sugar, salt, yeast, lard, etc., which will count as ingredientls for the bread she sells

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor tiene 34 años de edad, es separada, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos en su restaurante, vende comida como caldos, arroz y estofados de gallinas, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos que dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será para la compra de una refrigeradora para conservar los productos con los que elabora sus alimentos, con esto Flor tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y obtener mejores utilidades lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor, 34, is separated.  She lives with her two children in her own house in the San Felipe district, an agricultural and ranching community located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

She earns a living making and selling dishes in her restaurant.  She sells food like soup, rice, and chicken stew.  She has more than five years of experience in the field with steady customers who give her good personal and professional references.

The loan will be to buy a refrigerator to store the products with which she makes her dishes.  This will give Flor the possibility of increasing her sales and earning more profit, thus improving her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store the products she uses to make her dishes

loans.name: Iris Lilibeth

texts.es:
La señora Iris es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio que es la venta de abarrotería, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal desde hace 2 años.
Doña Iris sus principales clientes son vecinos de su colonia y alrededores solicita el apoyo del Préstamo para la compra de producto como azúcar, manteca, café, pan, refrescos, harina, sal, fósforos, detergente, jabón, huevos, salsas, arroz,  etc. Espera que en esta inversión pueda salir adelante en su negocio y así seguir apoyando a su familia. 
Iris sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un mercadito de abastos para su colonia y poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos.


Danli, Honduras – Mayo  del 2015
texts.en:
Señora Iris is an entrepreneurial woman engaged in commerce. Her principal sources of income comes from her business, which is the sale of groceries. She has tended this business personally for two years.

Doña iris' principal customers are neighbors from her neighborhood and its surrounding areas. She is applying for the support of the loan in order to purchase products such as sugar, lard, coffee, bread, soft drinks, flour, salt, matches, detergent, soap, eggs, sauces, rice, etc. She expects that with this investment she can make progress in her business and thus continue supporting her family.

Iris dreams of being able to expand her business and convert it to a small wholesale market for her neighborhood and being able to improve her source of income.


Danli, Honduras – May 2015

loans.use: to purchase sugar, lard, coffee, bread, soft drinks, flour, salt, matches, detergent, soap, eggs, sauces, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants" And Liggey" Group

texts.fr:
Groupement « And Liggey de l’association épouses des enseignants » regroupe cinq femmes  qui logent le même quartier et s’activent dans le commerce. 
La présidente s’appelle Khardiata, âgée de 48 ans, elle vend des fruits de mer depuis juste 1 an. Elle a démarré avec une somme de 100 000f aidé par son époux, depuis lors elle a fructifié son capital.
Khardiata n’a pas de charges et le bénéfice de l’activité est reversé dans son capital.
Puisqu’elle  a une clientèle un peu partout, elle désire améliorer son activité afin de pouvoir satisfaire cette dernière.
texts.en: The group called “And Liggey” of the association “Epouses des enseignants” is composed of women staying in the same district who are active in commerce. The president, Khardiata, is 48 years old and has been selling seafood for just a year. She began with funds amounting to 100,000 francs and is helped by her husband, who added to her capital. Khardiata has no [dependents] and the profit from her work is put back into her capital. Since she has customers just about everywhere, she would like to improve her business to satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell

loans.name: Fanaticas De Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FANATICAS DE JUAN PABLO II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de medias, confección y venta de trajes para damas y venta de ventanas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de trajes para damas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia con un poco de capital.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo confeccionará y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Fanáticas de Juan Pablo II Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Amalia's the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including vegetable sales, food sales, sock sales, tailoring of women's clothing, and window sales.

 The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Amalia.  She said she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of a loan officer from the institution.  Currently she has a business making and selling women's outfits.  She said she started the business on her own initiative with a small amount of capital.

Amalia's loan is to increase her capital with a wholesale purchase of fabric that she'll acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sew and sell in her sales space.  This job allows her to earn resources to support her family financially, because she's married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings the institution offers.

loans.use: to make and sell outfits

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants" Sope Abdou Dièye" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit » Epouses des Enseignants  Sope  Abdou Dièye » rassemble cinq  femmes qui logent le même quartier. 
La dame Ramatoulaye, âgée de la trentaine d’année est la responsable de ce groupe ; elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon de 6 ans et le cadet, âgé de 3 ans. Puisqu’ elle a son mari absent du pays, c’est elle qui gère donc la dépense quotidienne jusqu’à ce que ce dernier lui envoie  de l’argent.  Ramatoulaye s’active dans le travail et la commercialisation du poisson fumé, activité qu’elle pratique depuis maintenant 5 ans.
Comme ambition, elle souhaite acquérir des pirogues et pouvoir les exploiter  pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en: The loan group called “Epouses des Enseignants Sope  Abdou Dièye” is composed of women staying in the same district. Ramatoulaye, a lady in her 30’s, is the group’s official; she is a married mother of three, of whom the oldest is a boy, aged 6, and the youngest is 3. Since her husband is abroad, she is the the one who manages the day-to-day expenses until her husband sends money back. Ramatoulaye has been actively working, selling smoked fish. This is a business she has been in for five years now. Her ambition is that she would like to acquire small fishing boats and make use of them to maximize her profit.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish to resell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from clothing and plastic ware. Imelda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries like noodles, sardines, shampoo and other groceries for her general store business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries like noodles, sardines, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Hayarpi

texts.en: Hayarpi is 35 years old and she lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She is not married and she lives with her father and brother. Hayarpi has a higher education; she graduated from the Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of pedagogy and psychology. For many years she has worked at the city hospital. Hayarpi has now some dental problems and she must have a course of treatment, but she has some financial hardships. She is asking for a loan of 250.000 Armenian drams to pay for her course of dental treatment.

loans.use: to pay for her dental treatment

loans.name: Luis Espinal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUIS ESPINAL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sabina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugo de quinua, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de fresco hervido, venta de jugo de frutas y venta de joyas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sabina es integrante, ella indica ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de un asesor de crédito de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugo de quinua; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus hermanas hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra quinua por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luis Espinal" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima regional center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Sabina is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are: selling quinoa juice, selling food, selling blankets, selling fresh stews, selling fruit juice, and selling jewelry.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these microentrepreneurs, of whom Señora Sabina is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a loan adviser from the institution. At this time she has a business of selling quinoa juice. She lets it be known that she learned this business from her sisters some years ago.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy quinoa wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto, and later, after the preparation, she will sell it from her sales stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy quinoa wholesale

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants"khady Diagne" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe « Épouses des Enseignants Khady Diagne » est composé de cinq femmes qui évoluent dans le domaine du commerce. Des braves femmes qui logent dans une zone où existe une large possibilité d’avoir une activité qui peut générer du profit.
La présidente, madame Khady Diagne est une dame  âgée de 49 ans qui s’activent depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle vend un peu de tout. Elle est vendeuse de jeu de hasard (PMI : Pari Mutuel Urbain) depuis plus de 10 ans, mais c’est pratiquement ses enfants qui ont pris la relève. Elle vend de l’encens, du poisson fumé  et des tissus.  Avec le crédit, elle va renforcer son activité surtout de poisson fumé vu la période.
Madame Khady Diagne est marié et mère de 7 enfants ; elle appuie dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne mais surtout dans l’éducation de ses enfants. Elle veut leur donner un départ dans la vie. Elle souhaite aussi  améliorer son activité, voyager  vers Dubaï et aimerait construire sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
The group “Épouses des Enseignants Khady Diagne” is composed of five women who work in the domain of commerce. These good and honest women are staying in an area where profit-generating work is highly possible. The group’s president, Ms. Khady Diagne, is a 49-year-old woman who has been active for over ten years. She sells some of everything. And she has been a vendor of games of chance (PMI : Pari Mutuel Urbain) for over ten years, but practically speaking, her children are the ones who have taken over. She sells incense, smoked fish, and fabrics. With this loan, she is going to bolster her business, especially smoked fish, given the time period. 

Ms. Khady Diagne is a married mother of seven children; she helps in managing day-to-day expenses, the education of her children in particular. She wants to give them a head-start in life. Her wish also is to improve her business and travel to Dubaï, and she would one day like to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase incense and smoked fish to resell

loans.name: Dalva Raquel

texts.es:
La señora  Dalva Raquel de 52 años de edad es casada   y tiene dos hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 19 años al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café, cultiva el grano con la ayuda de su familia y también contrata para sembrar y limpiar a varios empleados.
Doña Dalva Raquel es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que hace trabajos de construcción, es una persona emprendedora que  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, grava, etc. porque desea construir una pequeña bodega para el almacén del grano, con el  apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar su patrimonio.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Dalva Raquel, 52, is married and has two dependent children.  She lives in a community in the south of Honduras.  She has her own home and has worked for 19 years growing corn, beans, and coffee.  She grows the grains with her family's help and also hires several employees to plant and to weed.

Dalva Raquel exemplifies work and dedication.  She has the support of her husband, who works in construction.  She's an enterprising person who's requesting the loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and other construction materials because she wants to build a small warehouse for storing grain.

She intends to improve her assets with the support of this loan.  Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, May 2015

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, etc. to build a small grain warehouse for her house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy an additional sack of rice to sell, 

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional sack of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Virgendina

texts.en:
Virgendina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virgendina is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Virgendina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Virgendina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virgendina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis, practica la agricultura y la crianza de ganado, cultiva específicamente maíz, su negocio lo ha realizado desde hace mucho tiempo y es su medio de subsistencia; vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos.
Está preparando todo para la próxima siembra y requiere de un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que le dará un buen desarrollo al cultivo de maíz y evitara problemas de plagas, espera comprar los materiales básicos para realizar sus trabajos en el tiempo preciso.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar sus ingresos y tener cosechas abundantes.
texts.en:
Luis works in agriculture, growing corn and raising livestock.  He has had his business for a long time and it is his means of sustenance.  He lives in his own home with his wife and children.

He is preparing for the next sowing season and needs a loan to buy farm supplies with which he can bring about a good corn crop and eliminate pest problems.  He is hoping to buy the necessary supplies in order to get his work done in time.  His hopes are to increase his income and have abundant harvests.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rene Del Transito

texts.es:
René, de 58 años de edad, no estudio, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo uno vive junto a él, los otros están acompaños, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también colabora con algunas actividades de la casa.

René, desde muy joven trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda y también trabaja en una finca cortando café, luego empezó a trabajar con su padre en sus propios cultivos  de maíz y frijol, actualmente trabaja una hectárea de maíz.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas y fertilizantes, porque no tiene dinero suficiente para comprarlos y tiene que iniciar a preparar la tierra.

El deseo de René, es siempre seguir trabajando en sus cultivos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
René, 58, didn't attend school.  He has four children, only one of whom lives with him; the others are married.  His wife is a homemaker and also helps with some household activities.

René has worked as a day laborer from a very young age.  He also works on a farm cutting coffee.  Then he started working with his father on his own corn and bean crops.  Currently he's farming one hectare of corn.

The loan he's requesting is to buy soil amendments, seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer, because he doesn't have enough money to buy them and he has to start preparing the land.

René's desire is to always keep working on his crops and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Munyazi

texts.en:
Munyazi is a married woman staying together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.
 
With the Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is a widow and lives with her daughter in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She worked in different workshops, and now she has her own small business. In her own space, she sells different domestic animals, turtles, and fishes; also special fodder and some accessories for all of it.

Astghik likes animals, and she does her work with pleasure and care towards the animals. She mentions that her business income at first was very little, but slowly it goes better. Now she needs some refreshing of her assortment of animals in order to keep her business, which is the only source of income for her family.

She will use this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to enlarge and refresh the assortment of animals that she sells in her zoo market.

loans.use: to enlarge and refresh the assortment of animals that she sells in her zoo market.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Maria is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jekaton Group

texts.fr:
ALIMA  est la dame qui  a ses deux (2)  mains sur le sac de riz sur la photo, c’est une  malienne ménagère, elle est  âgée  de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants  tous âgées plus  de 20 ans et tous marié. Son mari est un cultivateur et fait  l’élevage.
ALIMA  fait le commerce  de riz depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne en riz dans les  marchés environnant et revend  dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’elle  réalise lui permette  de  prendre en charge certaines dépenses de ses  petits-fils.
Elle  emprunte de l’argent auprès de RMCR pour pouvoir  acheter des sacs de riz à vendre. 
 Souvent confronté au problème de vente au marché, elle  souhaite  avoir un prêt  élevé dans l’avenir pour pouvoir  développer son  activité enfin d’acheté une charrette avec le profit.
texts.en:
ALIMA is a woman with two hands on the sack of rice in the photo. She is Malian homemaker, 56 years old, and the married mother of five children, all older than 20 and married. Her husband works in agriculture and raises livestock. ALIMA has been doing commerce in rice for over ten years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets and resells at the same markets. The profit she makes enables her to cover certain expenses for her grandchildren. 

She is borrowing money from the microfinance institution RMCR to purchase sacks of rice to sell. Often confronted with problems with sales at the market, she would like to have a bigger loan for the future to be able to develop her business, so as to use the profits to buy a cart.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, de 52 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor, no estudio porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y junto a su pareja procrearon tres hijos, pero ninguno vive junto a él, solo su pareja y un nieto viven con él.

Felipe, desde muy joven siempre le ha gustado el trabajo agrícola, ya que su padre se dedicaba al cultivo de maíz y frijol, pero también aprendió acerca de la albañilería, actualmente trabaja como albañil y también como agricultor en temporada.

El dinero de este crédito será para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para sembrar.
El sueño de Felipe, es poder obtener una excelente cosecha, porque la del año pasado no fue tan buena.
texts.en:
Felipe, 52, works as a farmer.  He didn't go to school because he didn't have the opportunity.  He's in a common-law relationship and he and his partner have had three children.  None of them live with him, however; only his partner and a grandson.

Felipe has enjoyed agricultural labor since he was very young, because his father grew corn and beans.  He also learned about bricklaying.  Currently he works as a bricklayer and also as a farmer during the season.

The money from this loan is to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor for planting.

Felipe's dream is to be able to yield an excellent harvest, because last year's wasn't very good.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor for planting

loans.name: Arisoa

texts.fr:
Arisoa, une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde, a 39 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est électronicien. Ils ont trois filles qui sont âgées de 5 à 15 ans. Elles sont toutes scolarisées actuellement. La famille habite ensemble dans sa propre maison.
Arisoa était depuis très long temps dans le commerce donc très habile en relation avec les clientèles et possède une bonne attitude commerciale. Elle vend depuis un an des ustensiles de cuisines et elle veut développer cette activité. Elle pense que c'est une activité non saisonnière et que les marchandises ne soient pas périssables. C'est mieux par rapport à ses anciennes activités (gargotes et fournitures scolaires).
Quand même, elle ne voudrait pas lâcher la fabrication de yaourts de maison, au contraire elle veut la développer et projette d'acheter un grand réfrigérateur supplémentaire.
texts.en: Arisoa, a hard-working woman and a problem-solver, is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is an electrician. They have three daughters, aged 5 to 15, who are currently all in school. The family lives together in the same house. For a very long time, Arisoa has been working in commerce, so she is very sophisticated with her customers and has a good attitude toward business. She has been selling kitchen utensils for a year, and she wants to develop this business. She is thinking that this is a non-seasonal business and that the merchandise is not perishable. This is better than her past businesses (eateries and school supplies). Even so, she would not want to let go of producing homemade yogurt; on the contrary, she wants to develop this and plans to purchase another big refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils: pots, pans, etc.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat and oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat and oil.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, actividades que desarrolla desde que tenía 10 años de edad, ya que su padre le solicitaba su ayuda en el negocio de la familia, tiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde. Vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo de 2 años de edad, él es la única persona que trabaja en el hogar.
Invertirá en su negocio comprando una vaquilla con el valor de $700.00 y otra parte lo utilizará para adquirir insumos agrícolas con los que podrá realizar el cultivo de granos básicos, de esta forma tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio, lo riesgos son hurtos o un mal invierno.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar la situación económica y brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander earns a living growing basic grains and raising livestock and pigs.  He has done this work since he was 10 years old because his father asked for his help in the family business.  His work schedule is 7 a.m. to 3 p.m.  He lives with his life partner and a two-year-old son.  He's the only person in the household who works.

He'll invest in his business with the purchase of a heifer worth $700.  He'll use another part of the loan to acquire agricultural inputs to grow basic grains.  That way he'll have the chance to improve his business.  The risks are theft or a bad winter.

Alexander wants to improve his financial situation and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and agricultural inputs for growing basic grains

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is 25 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city, now living in Fuzuli region with his family. Ilham is married and the father of two juvenile children. Two years ago he started his business – so that he has had an animal breeding business in his courtyard area for two years. Ilham wants to support his business and for that he needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount Ilham is planning to buy more calves. He gives great thanks for loans from Kiva organization. In the future he wants to build a house and to raise his children, and give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy more calves to increase his business.

loans.name: Sebastiana Santos

texts.es:
La señora  Sebastiana de 49 años de edad es casada  tiene dos hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad Valle,  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 25  años  al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, cultiva el grano con la ayuda de su familia y también contrata para sembrar y limpiar a varios empleados. Es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que está en Los Estados Unidos. 
Doña Sebastiana es una mujer líder está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos y grava, porque desea construir una pequeña bodega para el almacén del grano. Con el  apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su cosecha y obtener buenos resultados.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 49 years old, is married, and has two children who depend on her.  She lives the town of Valle, in the south of Honduras.  She has her own home and has worked for the 25 years growing corn and beans.  She grows her crops with the help of her family and also hires employees to plant and maintain her crops.  She is an example of hard work and dedication and has the support of her husband who is in the United States.

Sebastiana is a leader, and is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and gravel because she wants to build a small cellar to store grain.  With the support of the loan she intends to improve her harvest and obtain good crops.  One of her dreams is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build a grain cellar.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 48 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Nenita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jouanna

texts.en:
Jouanna is 30 years old and has two children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Jouanna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jouanna has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jouanna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Veromanga Jeannine

texts.fr:
Veromanga Jeannine est une femme courageuse et combattive de 39 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés, âgés entre 9 à 17 ans. Ses enfants n'habitent pas avec elle mais à la campagne avec sa mère. Et elle leurs envoie régulièrement de l'argent pour subvenir à leurs besoins tous les mois.
Elle commençait la vente des boucles d'oreilles depuis qu'elle avait 21 ans. Et elle développait son commerce petit à petit depuis et actuellement , le commerce s'oriente vers différents articles de beauté et de jouets.
Son désire est de pouvoir ouvrir une boutique, et construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: Veromanga Jeannine, 39 years old, is a courageous and determined woman. She is divorced and the mother of three children, aged 9 to 17, who are all in school. Her children do not live with her but in the countryside with her mother. Veromanga Jeannine sends her money regularly, each month, to meet their needs. She used to sell earrings when she was 21. She has developed her business bit by bit since then, and currently the business is focused on different beauty products and toys. Her wish is to be able to open a store and build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase earrings, toys, and different types of hair clips

loans.name: Elemy

texts.en:
Elemy is a 42-year-old, married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elemy has a buying-and-selling copra [dried coconut meat used for making coconut oil] business in the Philippines. Elemy requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more copra for making and selling cooking oil.

Elemy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elemy would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more copra for making and selling cooking oil.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been a tailor for twelve years now. She works from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy good materials for making better dresses and good suits. She also bought sewing products and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date materials. She dreams of making her business grow.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group Nzasa, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy better materials to make good suits and nice dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old and married with five children, who are in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Andriamanantena Philibert

texts.fr:
Andriamanantena Philibert est un père de famille débrouillard et responsable de 49 ans. Il est marié, sa femme ne travaille pas mais s'occupe du ménage et de leurs enfants. Ils ont deux enfants de 8 et 10 ans. Ces derniers vont tous les deux actuellement à l'école.
Andriamanantena Philibert gagne sa vie en dirigeant une petite boucherie. Il commençait en travaillant en tant qu'aide-boucher, et puis en 2005, il avait eu la possibilité d'ouvrir sa propre boucherie avec ses efforts personnels.
Il voudrait encore développer et étendre son commerce: ouvrir d'autres points de vente, faire de vente en gros, c'est son objectif professionnel.
Et comme tout père de famille digne, il souhaite offrir une qualité de vie meilleur à sa famille, une meilleur éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Andriamanantena Philibert is a father with a family. He is a problem-solver, the 49-year-old head of household, and married. His wife does not work but takes care of the home and their children. They have two children, aged 8 and 10, who are currently going to school. 

Andriamanantena Philibert earns his living running a small butcher shop. He began by working as a butcher’s helper. In 2005, he had the chance to open his own butcher shop and be on his own. He would still like to develop his business and expand it: open other sales outlets. Selling in bulk is his professional goal. And, as father worthy of the name, he would like to offer a better quality of life for his family and better education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase beef, pork, beef brains, and offal

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants"ngassamack 4" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Ngassamack 4, sous la houlette du groupe » Epouses des Enseignants » regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce depuis des années. Elles ont comme responsable, la dame Fama, âgée de 31 ans qui vend des chaussures et des habits, elle possède aussi un réfrigérateur et vend de la glace et de la crème. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce domaine. 
Fama est célibataire sans enfant et vit chez ses parents où elle participe à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. 
Elle est marchande ambulante, mais aspire à ouvrir un jour, une cantine afin d’alléger son activité.
texts.en:
The economic interest group called “Ngassamack 4” under the leadership of the group “Epouses des Enseignants” is composed of women who have been active in commerce for years. Their official is Ms. Fama, aged 31, who sells shoes and clothing. She also has a refrigerator and sells cream and ice. She has two years of experience in this domain. 

Fama is unmarried and has no children. She lives with her parents where she helps with managing day-to-day expenses. She is an itinerant merchants but aspires one day to open a stall to alleviate her work.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes to resell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and has 4 children.  Her husband is a fisherman who provides income to support the family. In 2013, she applied her membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pay her loans on a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for additional capital for fishing.  She has been making use of torn nets in fishing and foam in their fish vending. She hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she believes to raise more income and be of help for the expansion of her  business. Aurelia has found comfort in their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams, and to be used as additional capital

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en: Emmie earns through her fish vending business. She is a fully-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for more stocks of fish to resell. She is on her way to repaying the loans with her new profits. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of fish to resell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40 years old, married and has two children who are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Myrna has been raising pig for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and has four children.  Josephine is married and all of her children are sent to school.

Josephine is in the aquaculture business, farming oyster in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional bamboo, binder and other materials needed for her oyster farm.

Josephine has been farming oyster for five years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo, binder and other materials needed for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anna Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anna Marie is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Anna Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Menelyn

texts.en:
Menelyn is 29 years old and has three children.  Menelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Menelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening  in the Philippines. Menelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Menelyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sofía, vive con sus hijos, cuida de su familia y atiende una venta de refrescos, su negocio no tiene competencia y ya es bien reconocido en su localidad, trabaja de 10:00 a.m. a 3: 00 p.m., sus hijos le ayudan mucho en sus actividades domésticas y en las relacionadas con su negocio. 
Invertirá el capital que solicita en la compra de sillas, mesas, vasos, azúcar, bolsas, etc., ofrecerá mejor servicio y comodidad a sus clientes, su visión es tener nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son lograr construir una vivienda en una propiedad ubicada en su lugar de origen y que se la heredo su mamá
texts.en:
Sofia lives with her children and takes care of her family while selling soft drinks. Her business has no competitors and it is already well recognized in her locality. She works from 10:00 am until 3:00 pm. Her children help her a great deal in her domestic activities and in relation to her business.

Sofia will invest the capital she is requesting in purchasing chairs, tables, glasses, sugar, bags, etc., so that she can offer better service and comfort to her customers. Her vision is to add new customers and increase her sales and earnings.

Sofia's aspirations are to be able to construct a home on a property located in her place of origin that she inherited from her Mother.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, glasses, sugar, bags, etc., in order to offer better service and greater comfort to her customers.

loans.name: Astajona

texts.en:
Astajona is a widow with two children both attending school in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She is a cocoa trader mainly buying cocoa for sell. She started her business with an aim of taking care of her family needs and gets additional income from her cocoa gardens. 

She requests a loan to buy cocoa beans to sell to her customers and raise school fees for her children. Her family dream is educating her children to university and build a good house, as her business dream is expanding her cocoa business to new markets.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and married with four children.  With all four children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, soft drinks, diapers, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are currently in school.

Maricar is in the aquaculture business, farming oysters in the Philippines. Maricar requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

Maricar has been farming oysters for five years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase paint and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembes (farming tool) for farming her farm and fertilizers for top dressing her crops

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to  purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years. Sally earns additional income from food vending.

Sally is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials needed to maintain her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials needed to maintain her business.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
Sosote es una parroquia del cantón Rocafuerte  que se dedica directamente al arte de elaboración de objetos con tagua, tras un extenso proceso de pulido y pintado dan vida a más de 10 mil figuras,  también ofrece la muy solicitada longaniza o salchicha de vísceras de cerdo, estas se veden fritas o como sopa, toda esa delicia se prepara en las ollas de barro típicas de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Fernanda, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10 y 5 años que estudian en escuela y un bebé de un mes de nacido. El cónyuge es gasfitero y viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña Fernanda es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo. Trabaja dos días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Parte del crédito es para que su esposo lo invierta en un negocio de venta de cocos que está iniciando. 
 Este crédito es para comprar ropa y cocos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace un año y le gusta la unidad del grupo. Su sueño es tener un negocio fortalecido con un local propio y grande.
texts.en:
Sosote is a parish in the canton of Rocafuerte where people practice the art of making items from the ivory nut palm with an extensive process of polishing and painting.  It also offers the famous longaniza pork, which is sold fried or in a soup, as a traditional dish in the area.  

Fernanda is 30 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has three children.  The two older are 10 and 5 years old and attend school, and the third is a month old baby.  Her husband is a plumber and they live with his parents.

Fernanda is a housewife who supports the household expenses by selling clothing by catalog.  She works two days a week for two to three hours a day.  She offers her products on credit and collects every eight days.  She has done this work for five years and it is going very well.  Part of the loan is for her husband to invest in a business selling coconuts that he is starting.  

This loan will be used to purchase clothing and coconuts.  She has been a member of the credit group for a year and likes the unity of the group.  Her dream is to have a strong business with a large shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and coconuts.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants:gpf Sounkarou Fily" Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Sounkarou fily  est un sous groupe des » Épouses des enseignants » qui  rassemble cinq personnes s’activant diversement. La responsable, madame Awa, fait de la vente de produits d’aloès Vera, de poisson fumé et de l’aliment volaille depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit  auparavant, mais juste pour renforcer son activité car avec la vente d’aloès Vera, il faut faire tôt la commande pour maintenir  la clientèle régulière. Elle pourra aussi stocker du poisson fumé pour la saison des pluies prochaines. Mère Awa comme on l’appel, est veuve et a cinq enfants dont sa fille ainée âgée de 37 ans et la plus petite, de trois  ans. C’est une brave femme car grâce aux revenus, elle peut s’occuper de la dépense quotidienne, de ses besoins et de ceux de ses enfants. Elle ne se préoccupe que d’améliorer  son activité et mettre ses enfants à l’abri du besoin.
texts.en:
The group called “Sounkarou fily”,  a sub-group of “Épouses des enseignants”, is composed of five persons who are active in many ways. The group’s official, Ms. Awa, has been selling aloe vera products, smoked fish, and chicken feed for over ten years now. She has never had a loan before, but just for bolstering her business, since selling aloe vera requires reordering soon to keep regular customers. She will also be able to stock smoked fish for the rainy season. 

Mother Awa, as they call her, is a widow and has five children, including her oldest daughter, aged 37, and the youngest, a 3-year-old. Awa is a good and honest woman, and she can take care of day-to-day expenses, thanks to her income. She can also support herself and her children. She is reoccupied only with improving her business and sheltering her children from need.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish, chicken feed, and aloe products to resell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a hardworking woman with four children. She runs a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines and earns additional income by buying and selling fish.

Loida has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional stock to sell from her store such as coffee, sugar, chips, bread, etc. She is working to build it up so as to help secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell from her sari-sari

loans.name: Frediswinda

texts.en:
Frediswinda is 71 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Frediswinda has a broom making and selling business in the Philippines. Frediswinda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her broom business.

Frediswinda has been in this business for twenty years. 

In the future, Frediswinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her broom business

loans.name: Rudy Antonio

texts.es:
Rudy, de 36 años de edad, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está acompañado y tiene dos hijos pequeños que están estudiando y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Rudy, trabaja como albañil en su comunidad, se dedica a construir casas gracias a las enseñanzas de su tío, también se dedica a sembrar maíz y jícamas.

Rudy, necesita el crédito para comprar semillas, abono, pagar jornaleros y pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrara. 

El sueño que tiene Rudy, es poder construir una vivienda más digna, ya que la que tiene es de palma de coco.
texts.en:
Rudy, 36 years old, only studied up to fifth grade. He is currently in a relationship and has two young children who are studying. His partner works in the household chores.

Rudy is a construction worker in his community; he makes a living building houses thanks to his uncle's teachings. He also plants corn and jicama (edible tuber). Rudy needs the loan to buy seeds, compost, and to pay day workers and rent for the land where he'll sow.

The dream that Rudy has is to be able to build a decent home, as his current one is made of coconut palm tree.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and to pay day workers and land rental.

loans.name: Zobia

texts.en:
Zobia is a housewife and a mother of four children. The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. 

Zobia's husband is the main earner in the family and generates all his income from driving a rickshaw. Unfortunately, the current rickshaw has completely broken down, halting the inflow of income. This has resulted in Zobia's children skipping school due to lack of resources at their mother's disposal. Zobia requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. 

Hence, Zobia wants a loan to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again. This would streamline all her activities so that she could send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

Ngome has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, Ngome wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis City. He has an internet cafe in the city, where he provides games for the children, and also general services for the university and school students.
 
Mohammad would like to improve his business, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more personal computers and other supplies for his business.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo in his internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy more personal computers and other supplies for his business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years.

Marilyn has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling brooms in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Marina is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her broom-making business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her broom-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pullovers, coats, and jackets

loans.name: Fátima Lucia

texts.es:
Sosote es una parroquia del cantón Rocafuerte  que se dedica directamente al arte de elaboración de objetos con tagua, tras un extenso proceso de pulido y pintado dan vida a más de 10 mil figuras,  también ofrece la muy solicitada longaniza o salchicha de vísceras de cerdo, estas se veden fritas o como sopa, toda esa delicia se prepara en las ollas de barro típicas de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 16,15 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en escuela y en colegio. El cónyuge es comerciante vende cocos.
Doña Fátima hace cuatro años empezó un negocio en una cancha de voleibol cercana a la casa, ahí ella vende fritadas y hornado (platos típicos del Ecuador hechos con carne de cerdo), trabaja los fines de semanas desde las 11h00 hasta las 15h00 o hasta que se acabe lo preparado, sus  clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos lo que la hace especial. Cuando está libre le ayuda a su esposo en la venta de cocos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar carne de cerdo y cocos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace un año  y le gusta porque tienen seguro médico tanto para ella como para su familia.Su sueño es que sus hijos sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
Sosote is a parish of the Rocafuerte canton that is directly engaged in the art of making objects with tagua (a nut with an interior that looks and feels like ivory).  After an extensive process of polishing and painting, they give life to more than ten thousand figures.  This area also offers the highly sought after pork sausage, which can be served fried or in soup.  All of these delightful foods are served in the earthenware pots typical of the area.  

This is where Fatima lives.  She is 38 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has four children aged 17, 16, 15, and 7 years old.  Her children are in school.  Her spouse is a merchant selling coconuts.  

Fatima began a business on a volleyball court near her house four years ago.  There, she sells fried dishes and hornado (traditional Ecuadorian dishes with pork).  She works on the weekends from 11:00 am to 3:00 pm or until she runs out of prepared food.  Her customers prefer her because of the seasoning she puts in the dishes that make them special. When she is free, she helps her spouse selling coconuts.

She is going to use this loan to buy pork and coconuts.  She has been in the loan group for one year, and she likes it because they have health insurance for her and her family.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pork and coconuts.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is a 23-year-old, married, Lebanese woman, who lives with her husband and two children. 

Her husband works as an employee in a company, to satisfy the requirements of life, and he earns a barely fair income. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children's educational fees. 

She has said that the loan will surely help her to register her children for the coming school year, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, fish net, etc for her fishing business.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years. Edna earns more income from her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, fish net, etc

loans.name: Oscar Eulises

texts.es:
Oscar, ha mejorado su negocio taller de estructuras metálicas y granja de gallinas ponedoras con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, sus deudas se han reducido y está compartiendo un mejor estilo de vida con su familia, se siente dichoso por la llegada de un hijo.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para para poder comprar láminas, tubos, hierro, pintura y otros materiales para equipar el taller de estructuras metálicas, su lucha constante es mantenerse trabajando para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Oscar has improved his metal structures workshop business and his egg-laying chicken farm through the help of the previous loan. He has reduced his debts and is sharing a better quality of life with his family. He feels fortunate due to the arrival of a baby boy.

He needs a new loan to buy metal sheets, tubes, iron, paint, and other materials in order to stock his metal workshop. His constant challenge is to continue working so he can cover his family’s necessities.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, tubes, iron, paint, and other materials in order to stock his metal workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She works hard in addition to her husband who works as a van driver to provide them with the necessary living needs and education.
Three years ago, Saada opened her fruits and vegetables selling shop. Since that time she has worked hard to increase her family's income and develop their living.
Her income combined with her husband's income are barely enough to cover their family's living needs. Thus for this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees.
She hopes that soon she can buy a car that will help her in business transportation so that she can buy her goods from better markets.

loans.use: To pay for her children school tuition fees

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 25-year-old married man, from a village near Ramallah City. He has an internet cafe in the village, where he provides games for the children, and also general services for the university and school students.
 
Jehad would like to improve his business, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more personal computers and other supplies for his business. 

Jehad appears in the photo, in his internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy more personal computers and other supplies for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase spaghetti

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, poles, sand, gravel and barbed wire to build a retaining wall, a gutter and to fence in her property.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and brick in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 53-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He owns a van for transportation. In 2010 she decided to start her own business and opened a grocery store to supplement the family's income and help her husband. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more merchandise and to renovate her shop. She states that the loan will surely help her increase her business productivity by a fair percentage which will return higher profits to her.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and to renovate her grocery shop

loans.name: Fozi

texts.en:
Fozi is 36 years old, married and has five children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells used clothing. He has been running this business for many years. His business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family.
It is necessary to grow the business to meet the family's needs but a lack of capital is the major problem for him. 
Therefore, Fozi took out a loan for her husband’s business. With help from this loan, he will purchase more used clothes to sell. 
Fozi thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy used cloth for her husband's used cloth selling business.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr:
Agée de 44 ans, Brigitte est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Les deux derniers sont scolarisés: le cadet suit actuellement une formation professionnelle en informatique et le dernier est un petit collégien. Son ainé et son époux l'appuient dans l'exercice des activités source de revenu de la famille.
Brigitte avec l'aide de son mari dirige un commerce de poissonnerie et de vente de légumes. La demande de prêt aura cette fois-ci pour objet de financer la poissonnerie. Cette activité, est héritée de ses parents. Elle avait commençait en 1991. Elle possède beaucoup d'années d'expérience dans cette filière.
Elle a déjà beaucoup de clients fixes et la plupart sont des restaurateurs. Son désire est de devenir grossiste en poissonnerie.
texts.en:
Brigitte, aged 44, is a married mother of three children. The two youngest are in school: the youngest is currently taking professional training in software development, and the last one is a middle-school student. The oldest and her husband support the income source for the family. With the help of her husband, Brigitte runs a fish business and sells vegetables. 

The goal of this particular loan request is to finance her fish shop, a business passed down from her parents. She began in 1991. She has many years of experience in this area of work. She already has many regular customers, and most of them are restauranteurs. Her wish is to become a wholesale merchant of fish.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kg of saltwater fish and 300 kg of freshwater fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Crisologa alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de  venta de crianza de animales menores, la socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc community bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Crisologa alternates her daily activities, working in the business of selling young animals. The associate is grateful for the loan and promises to complete the payments. The associate is a responsible and committed person. The associate raises her animals to later sell them to the customers who request them. It is in this way that the associate moves her family forward.

The associate requests this loan to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Rubenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rubenia, utilizo el préstamo anterior para fortalecer la venta de café, chocolate, pan y meriendas, cuenta con nuevos clientes y su situación financiera es mucho más favorable, su familia se mantiene.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar cajas de café, chocolate, pan, vasos y platos desechables, para salir a vender y mantener la continuidad de su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Rubenia used her previous loan in order to improve her sales of coffee, chocolate, pastries, and snacks. She has new customers and her financial situation is much more favorable. Her family is doing well. 

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy boxes of coffee, chocolate, pastries, disposable cups and plates, so that she can go out and sell, so that she can continue her economic improvement.

loans.use: to buy boxes of coffee, chocolate, pastries, disposable cups and plates, so that she can go out and sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 56-year-old married woman, who has eleven children, two of whom are in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Eufemia has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for six years, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has five children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business near neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of transpoprtation and seasonality in her place of operation. 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Jose Saturnino

texts.es:
José, está muy agradecido por haber recibido apoyo con el préstamo anterior, se pudo comprar todo los materiales básicos para los cultivos de granos básicos y hortalizas, los cuales han dado cosechas abundantes y también la ganadería ha aumentado, los ingresos se han estabilizado y no ha tenido dificultades para continuar trabajando.
Está interesado en mantenerse trabajando con créditos por lo que hace una nueva solicitud, lo necesita para pagar el alquiler del terreno en que trabaja así mismo comprará insumos agrícolas y concentrado para alimentar al ganado, espera tener tan buenos resultados como con el financiamiento anterior.
texts.en:
José is very grateful for having received support through the previous loan. He was able to buy all of the basic materials for his basic grains crops and vegetables, which have given abundant harvests. His number of cattle has also increased. His income has stabilized and he hasn’t any difficulties preventing him from working.

He is interested in continuing to work with loans, which is why he is making a new request. He needs to pay the rent for the parcel of land on which he works. He will also buy agricultural inputs and concentrated feed for his cattle. He hopes to have equally good results as with the previous loan.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the parcel of land on which he works and to buy agricultural inputs and concentrated feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Hanitriniaina

texts.fr:
52 ans, divorcée, mère de trois enfants, Hanitriniaina est une femme courageuse et travailleuse. 
Elle est couturière mais en plus, elle vend aussi des friperies depuis 2014 pour gagner plus d'argent afin de pouvoir réaliser ses rêves et ses objectifs.
Elle demande un prêt pour renouveler ses stocks, elle va acheter deux balles de friperie avec. Son objectif est développer et étendre l'activité vente de friperie. Et sa priorité actuelle et immédiate est l'éducation de son dernier enfant qui a 19 ans. Il est en classe de 1ère et prépare dès maintenant son Baccalauréat et sa rentrée à l'université.
texts.en: Hanitriniaina, aged 52, is a divorced mother of three. She is a courageous and hard-working woman. A dressmaker, she also has been selling secondhand clothing since 2014 to earn more money, so as to realize her dreams and goals. She is asking for a loan to renew her inventory. She is going to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing. Her goal is to develop her business selling used clothing and to expand it. Her current and immediate priority is the education of her youngest child, who is 19 and a high school senior getting ready for graduating exams and entry into a university.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, meats, vegetables, charcoal, ...

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is a 26-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Isam wants to open his own business: a mobile store. He has some experience in selling mobiles and maintenance from his previous job. Isam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy mobile phones and accessories to resell in his new store. This will make him independent. Isam appears in the photo in his new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories to resell in his new store

loans.name: Chroep

texts.en:
Chroep (shown in photo) is 46 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1986. She has two daughters. One is married and one is attending school.

Chroep has been a weaver and farmer for 12 years, while her husband has been a policeman for 20 years.  Now she wants to increase her production.  She is applying for a loan to purchase a weaving machine.

She wants to improve her family.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Alejandrina  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos secos, la socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende  su mercadería a  todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz, trigo entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc. The bank is located in the Urubamba Province and Department of Cusco. 

Alejandrina alternates her daily activities and makes a living in the sale of dry products. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments. She is a responsible and determined person. She sells her merchandise to all her customers who request it and this is how she supports her family. She is requesting the loan to buy corn, wheat, and other items.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dresses, towels, pants, shirts, skirts, and other items of clothing in order to meet seasonal demands

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina is 78 years old and widowed. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bernardina has a general store business in the Philippines. Bernardina requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods personal care products, noodles and other groceries.

Bernardina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Bernardina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods personal care products, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to set up her husband's green grocery shop.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 39-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has spent four years working as a female hairdresser and beautician in her hometown where she greets her customers with a great smile. She started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. Currently, Rima wants a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase a tattoo machine to satisfy her clients’ needs.  She looks forward to opening her own beauty salon as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tattoo machine
