Mario works in agriculture growing beans and corn.  When his harvest is ready he stores it in the barn shown in the picture and then sells the product in different markets near his house.  He lives in his own house with his family.  
Mario is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc. to continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Jilman

texts.es:
Jilman es un joven de tan solo 21 años de edad, creativo, guiado por su pasión y su inteligencia, esta persona tiene gran habilidad con las manos realiza unos tatuajes estupendos, (ver mural con algunos ejemplos), empezó con bajo capital, con una máquina que compro con sus ahorros, realizando trabajando a sus s amigos y conocidos a bajo costo, fue tanto el éxito y furor que tenían sus creaciones que con el pasar del tiempo se volvió su fuente de sustento con el cual está pagando estudios y ayudando a su madre.


Jilman se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el motivo es para invertir en su negocio, comprar camillas, tintas, lámparas, sillas, implementos de aseo, pintura, para adecuar su local, darle un toque comercial.

Tu préstamo incentivara la empresa de un joven como Jilman que quiere apoyar a su madre, que quiere estudiar que no busco excusas, por el contrario fundo un negocio con sus habilidades y conocimientos con el que está haciéndose cargo del hogar.
texts.en:
Jilman is a creative young man of only 21 years. He is lead by his passion and his intelligence. He has great manual skills and creates wonderful tattoos (see the wall for some examples). He started with a small capital and a machine he bought from his savings, tattooing friends and acquaintances for a low price. It was a great success and his creations were sensational. With time, it turned into his source of livelihood, with which he is paying for his studies and helping his mother.

Jilman is requesting a loan to invest in his business, and to buy stretchers, ink, lamps, chairs, cleaning equipment, and paint to refurnish his parlor and give it a professional look.

Your loan encourages the enterprise of a young man like Jilman, who wants to support his mother, and who wants to study and not make excuses, but on the other hand founded a business with his skills and knowledge, with which he is taking charge of their home.

loans.use: to buy stretchers, ink, lamps, chairs, cleaning equipment, and paint to refurnish his parlor and give it a professional look.

loans.name: Tatiana Paola

texts.es:
Tatiana es una mujer casada de 35 años de edad que diariamente lucha por el progreso de su familia, su profesión es la venta de mercancía como ropa, calzado, accesorios gracias a este negocio logra generar una buena calidad de vida, ella es una persona muy trabajadora en las mañanas despacha a su hijo y marido para la escuela, en las tarde sale a vender los productos, recoge a su hijo y llega en la noche para seguir ejerciendo su papel como ama de hogar, es una mujer de admirar debido a su control y manejo de tiempo, a su humildad y buena disposición que pone para hacer las cosas.


Tatiana quiere pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener un local o punto de venta fijo, pero para lograrlo primero debe aumentar sus ventas y hacerse reconocer más en el mercado.


Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de calzado, ropa y accesorios para mujer, quiere acelerar sus ventas, tener variedad de marca y estilos para mostrar, antojar a su cliente e incentivarlo a que compre.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a 35 year old married woman who fights every day for her family's progress. Her profession is selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and accessories. Thanks to this business she is able to generate a good quality of life. She is a very hardworking woman. In the morning, she sends her son and husband off to school and in the afternoon she goes out to sell her products. She picks up her son and nighttime comes, when she continues to fulfill her role of housewife. She is an admirable woman because of her ability to control and manage her time, and for her humility and good attitude she has when she does things.

Tatiana wants to pay for her children's education and to have a locale or a permanent sales stall. In order to achieve this, she has to increase her sales and become more well known in the market.


She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of women's shoes, clothing and accessories. She wants to accelerate her sales, have a variety of brands and styles to show, attract her customers and motivate them to buy.

loans.use: to buy a variety of women's shoes, clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Ovidio Arcangel

texts.es:
Él es Ovidio un hombre soltero de 44 años de edad, no tiene hijos solo se basta de su negocio de venta de frutas ubicado a la salida de un sistema de transporte para generar los ingresos con los que paga arriendo, cuentas de servicios públicos.

Ovidio solo tiene un carro de supermercados y en él alberga toda sus frutas, le gustaría tener un carro frutero algo más estandarizado que agrado a los clientes y les de confianza comprarle.

El sueño de Ovidio es comprar una vivienda propia, en esto ha trabajo por casi 10 años y sigue luchando por lograr su objetivo.

En vista de las condiciones tanto laborales, como climáticas, Ovidio quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de frutas, mangos, peras, manzanas, piña naranja, mandarina, sandia, guanábana y si le sobra capital quiere comprar el carro frutero que tanto desea.
texts.en:
This is Ovidio. He is a single, 44 year old man. He has no children and he is busy with his fruit selling business, located by a highway exit. He does this to generate income to pay for his rents and utilities bills.

Ovidio just has a supermarket cart where he keeps all his fruit. He would like to have a fruit cart, something more standardized to please his customers and earn their trust so they will buy from him.

Ovidio's dream is to buy his own home. He has done this work for almost 10 years and he is still fighting toward his goal. 

In view of the working and weather conditions, Ovidio wants to ask for a loan to invest in buying fruit such as mangos, pears, apples, pineapples, oranges, tangerines, watermelon, and guanabana. If he has any capital left over, he wants to buy the fruit cart that he wants so much.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as mangos, pears, apples, pineapples, oranges, tangerines, watermelon, guanabana

loans.name: Isrrael Antonio

texts.es: Isrrael de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
46-year old Isrrael lives in his own home with his wife and four children. He has earned his living for 15 years growing maize and beans. After the harvest he sells the produce in neighbouring towns where he has many regular customers.

Isrrael is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, insecticide and herbicide etc. as is shown in the photo. Then he will be able to continue growing his crops which are his only source of income, and earn more money.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, insecticide and herbicide etc

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés una persona de 57 años de edad, padre de 4 hijos, un hombre casado, su cualidades son responsabilidad, tolerancia, respeto y cordialidad, las cuales implementa muy bien en su chaza de venta de dulces, frituras, cigarrillos y chocolates, este humilde negocio que se ve en la foto lo inicio en el año 2000 como necesidad económica y ha brindado estabilidad y calidad de vida a su familia. 


Andrés trabaja durante 10 horas 5 días a la semana, su principal objetivo es el sostenimiento de su negocio pues de ello depende de cómo van a vivir.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido y una sombrilla grande, ya que cuando hay fuertes lluvias no puede salir a vender o tiene que refugiarse y esto le genera perdida de capital.

Apoya a este empresario a seguir realizando su labor que lo ha hecho tan feliz y que ha apoyado tanto a su familia, un préstamo sostendrá un empleo y a toda una familia, anímate!
texts.en: Andrés is 57 years old, married and the father of 4 children. His qualities are responsibility, tolerance, respect and cordiality, which he implements really well in his food stall selling candy, chips, cigarettes and chocolates. He started this humble business that you can see in the photo in the year 2000 as an economic necessity. It has provided stability and quality of life to his family. Andrés works for 10 hours a day, 5 days a week. His main objective is maintaining his business because how they live depends on it. He wants to ask for a loan to buy supplies and a large umbrella, because when there are strong rains he can not go out and sell or he has to take refuge and this results in a loss of capital. Support this businessman to continue doing his work, which he has done so happily and has supported his family so much. A loan will maintain a job and a family. Go for it!

loans.use: to buy supplies and a big umbrella, because when there are strong rains he can not go out and sell or he has to take refuge and this results in a loss of capital.

loans.name: Jianguo

texts.en:
Jianguo is a 42-year-old man who makes a living raising pigs. He has two daughters who are both in school, and he has to support his old parents. He started to raise pigs four years ago, and at the end of the year, he will sell more than 20 pigs. So far, he has about 30 pigs to be raised and will be sold in the near future. He pays for the whole family's daily costs with the money he earns via raising pigs.

Jianguo has been unable to walk without crutches since he was young, for when he was a little boy he developed a severe illness and did not get on-time treatment.

This year, the costs of raising pigs are increasing. Furthermore, his parents are getting older, and cannot make a living for themselves. In order to improve their living environment and standards, Jianguo requested 20,000 from MicroCred. He will use the money to purchase more pigs and feeds. He hopes that he will earn enough money to rebuild his house to provide a more spacious living situation for his parents, so that he enables the elderly to enjoy their old age well into the future.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in vegetables, fruit, corn and beans to give her customers variety.

loans.name: Oscar Mario

texts.es: Don Oscar de 50 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa, es un hombre trabajador, toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo, en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, como todo campesino cada año realiza la misma actividad agrícola de esta forma es como logra sacar los ingresos para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para invertir en abono, fertilizante, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con el cultivo así poder tener una cosecha abundante ya que es la única forma que conoce de ganarse la vida y así seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He is a hardworking man who has spent his whole life in the countryside where he grows maize and beans as do all the farmers in the area. Through this work he manages to provide for his family on a daily basis.

Oscar is seeking a loan to buy compost, fertilizer, insecticide etc. so he can continue growing his crops. Then he will have a productive harvest. Agriculture is the only way he knows of earning a living and continuing to provide for his family.

loans.use: buy compost, fertilizer, insecticide etc

loans.name: Hector Ovidio

texts.es: Hector de 38 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años almacena sus productos en los graneros que muestra la fotografia, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Él vive con su madre el desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo ya que dentro de poco empieza la época de siembra, para ello solicita un crédito para invertir en: semillas, fertilizante, controles de plagas y abono para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar sus  condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Hector is 38 years old.  He started working the land since he was very young and he's been growing corn and beans for 20 years.  He stores his products in the barns shown in the picture.  Through this activity he's able to have a better income and give his family a better quality of life.  He lives with his mother.  
He wishes to invest in materials for his fields since the planting and growing season is approaching.  He's requesting a loan to invest in seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to continue growing his crops.  He hopes this will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Don Fabián de 52 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a las siembras y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder obtener una buena cosecha, vende su producto en todas las zonas aledañas de donde el reside, es un hombre muy  trabajadora siembre esta buscando la manera de salir adelante, por eso decidió  solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, herbicida, abonos etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fabian is 52 years old and lives together with his wife in their own house. 

He makes a living by growing basic grains like corn and beans. He has been doing this for twenty years and with his gained experience he has been able to produce a great crop. He sells his products in all the areas surrounding where he lives. 

He is a very hard-working man, always looking for ways to improve his financial situation. This is why he decided to request a loan with Integral, which allows him to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, and so on, to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertliizer, seeds, compost, herbicide etc

loans.name: Sindy Vanessa

texts.es:
Sindy Vanessa tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y crianza de animales menores, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras para su negocio, con esto ella espera incrementar sus ingresos lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sindy Vanessa is 28 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives in the district of Zaña, a community close to the Jequetepeque River valley. The people here make a living in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province that belongs to the Lambayeque Region in the Northern Andes of Perú. 

She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables and raising small animals. She has experience in the business and has regular customers who give good personal and work references for her. She is asking for a loan to buy a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables for her business. With the loan, she hopes to increase her income which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 27 years old, married and blessed with two children. He operates a motorcycle transport business. He has applied for his first loan to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition for business.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His hope for the future is to start a motorcycle spare parts shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition for business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria Dolores is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maria Dolores has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Maria Dolores requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria Dolores has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Maria Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Margarita has a knitting business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Margarita has been in this business for 11 years. Margarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her knitting business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 59-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
As a parent, Priscilla works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling food supplements in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Priscilla is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of food supplements to sell in her food supplement business.

Priscilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 54 years old and married with ten children. With three children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosalina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba de 62 años desde su miscelánea ubicada en su residencia ofrece un diversificado surtido de detalles para toda ocasión a sus conocidos, vecinos y transeúntes del barrio en el que reside en Barranquilla. Esta emprendedora mujer decidió arriesgarse a cambiar de actividad, ella comercializaba carne y viseras en el mercado,  para ello debía de estar desde la madrugada en esta labor. Al separarse de su cónyuge y querer dedicar más tiempo a sus hijos los cuales había descuidado debido a los horarios que manejaba, planteó la posibilidad de incursionar en otra labor comercial desde la comodidad de su hogar.  Hoy en día su miscelánea le proporciona su sustento permitiéndole tener una mejor calidad de vida, su compromiso y entrega le han permitido tener éxito en su negocio y una demanda mayor cada día, ella está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de accesorios para damas y útiles escolares.  Su meta es continuar trabajando con entusiasmo y dedicación, para así poder contribuir a sus nietas en sus estudios con la finalidad de que sean unas profesionales.
texts.en: Elba, 62 years old, offers a wide variety of items in her variety store located in her home, for all sorts of occasions, to acquaintances, neighbors and people who travel through the neighborhood where she lives in Barranquilla. This enterprising woman decided to take the risk and change her job. She sold meat and entrails in the market, but this required her to be working from the early morning hours. When she separated from her spouse, she wanted to spend more time with her children, whom she had neglected due to the hours that she kept, she had the idea of starting another commercial venture from the comfort of her home. Today, her variety store provides her sustenance, allowing her to have a better quality of life. Her commitment and dedication have allowed her to have success in her business and a demand which increases each day. She is applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in an assortment of ladies' accessories and school supplies. Her goal is to continue working with enthusiasm and dedication so to be able to contribute to her granddaughters' education with the end of them becoming professionals.

loans.use: to invest in a new assortment of ladies' accessories and school supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 45-year-old accountant who runs a bookkeeping and accounting consultancy. He is a father of 3 children; 1 girl and 2 boys. 

Samuel says he decided to start offering accounting services after his friends kept coming to him for advice on how to do their tax returns and on how to budget for their households. "I saw the need to assist people to better manage their finances so that they can build stable future for their families" he says. This continuous demand for his services has seen his business grow and create employment for one person. 

He now wants to open an office in the CBD area. He has secured space and is requesting a loan to buy office furniture; specifically one table and 3 executive chairs, as well as two computers and to install a CCTV system. 

Samuel hopes to have 2 more branches around Johannesburg employing at least 10 people within the next 3 years. He is ambitious, calculative and hardworking and is a firm believer in financial literacy as a way out of poverty among disadvantaged communities.

loans.use: To buy office furniture, two computers and a CCTV system.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 41 years old and is married with a child. His child goes to school and wife is a nurse at a local polyclinic. Adil’s family is living in Fuzuli region but for 23 already years they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. 

Adil is involved in an animal breeding business. At present he needs a loan of an amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason Adil has applied to Komak company. With this loan he wants to repair the stall for the cows. 

He says he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and its lenders for their help. In the future Adil wants to give a good education to his child.

loans.use: to repair the stall for the cows and increase business.

loans.name: Magdalena De La Paz

texts.es: Doña Magdalena de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee un comedor cerca de su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y construyendo un muro pero con lo que obtiene se sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita a integral un crédito para la compra de  laminas, ladrillos, hierro, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Magdalena is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has a small restaurant near her home. With her earnings from the sales she manages to settle some house expenses. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof and building a wall, but with her sales earnings she doesn't have enough to fulfill it. For this reason, she is asking Integral for a loan to buy metal sheets, bricks, iron, cement, sand and to pay labor, so that she and her family can live more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, bricks, iron, cement, sand and to pay labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to increase the store's stock.

loans.name: Erickson Eduardo

texts.es: Erickson, tiene 23 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en un barrio del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Erickson se dedica a prestar el servicio de Mototaxi donde transporta personas de una aldea a otra. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años y es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 17,000 Lempiras para compra de repuestos para darle mantenimiento y reparación a su unidad de trabajo que es la mototaxi. Su meta es seguir siendo emprendedor para generar ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Erickson is 23 years old, married, has two children, and lives in a neighborhood of the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Erickson works providing services with his motorcycle taxi, where he transports people from one village to another. He has decided to ask for a loan of 17,000 lempiras to purchase parts to maintain and repair his work vehicle, which is the motorcycle taxi. His goal is to continue being an entrepreneur to generate income and help his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ella es Ana una confeccionista de 36 años de edad, mujer luchadora, trabajadora que genera dos empleos, y esto lo logro en tan solo un año de operación, una persona que no quiere frenar su progreso, que aprovechara su buen momento para invertir en su negocio y lograr los mayores contratos posibles buscando siempre fidelizar a los clientes. 

Por ello Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar 2 máquinas de coser para duplicar su número de operarias, un préstamo que no solo beneficiaría a Ana sino que ayudara a que una persona se emplee.

Con el negocio Ana busca pagar la educación de sus hijos, generar empleo, convertirse en una de las confeccionista principales de la ciudad y al ritmo que va tiene muy buenas posibilidades de lograrlo, por ello apóyala, esta persona vale la pena quiere crecer y lo demuestra con resultados.
texts.en:
This is Ana, a 36 year old seamstress, a hard-working woman who has generated two jobs, and this she achieved in only one year of operation.  She is a person who does not want to slow her progress, but will take advantage of this good timing to invest in her business and secure the best contracts possible, while always looking for customer loyalty.

For this reason, Ana wants to request a loan to purchase two sewing machines to double her number of operators, a loan that will not only benefit Ana, but will also help whomever she employs.

With this business, Ana is looking to pay for her children's education, generate jobs, and become one of the main clothing manufacturers in the city, and with the momentum she has, she has a good possibilty of achieving this.  It is worth supporting this person because she wants to grow and will demonstrate it with results.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines to double her number of operators.

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mitchelle is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Mitchelle has a business selling religious articles in the Philippines. Mitchelle requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mitchelle has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Mitchelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grill, chairs and tables for her customers.

loans.name: Shufang

texts.en:
Shufang is a 59-year-old woman. She has two children and both are far away from home. Shufang started to grow vegetables - lotus root - to make a living about 20 years ago with the help of her husband.

In order to support the family, her husband found another job. He uses a tricycle to carry goods for a factory. Two years ago, Shufang and her husband lived in a thatched cottage; the living conditions were very difficult. Seeing that everyone else in the village repaired their houses, Shufang and her husband decided to build a storied house, which cost them all the savings they had made over the years.  

Shufang requested 20,000  CNY from Microcred. She will use the money to buy fertilizer to fertilize the vegetables and paddy. She and her husband also planted 100 acres of paddy. 

Shufang describes herself as very honest. Her dream to have a good harvest in this year with the help of MicroCred.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to fertilize the vegetables and paddy.

loans.name: Bakilana Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her mid 30s, is single with one son who is still at school. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 5am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Joyce's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group Bakilana which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a woman and 30 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Sheila has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Sheila requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like brushes, etc.

Sheila has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Sheila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like brushes and other things.

loans.name: Sara Emilia

texts.es: Sara de 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en vivienda propia en su comunidad se caracterizan por ser trabajadora y honesta. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza,  sale a vender todas las tardes y visita las casa de las personas que siempre le compran en ocasiones ya llegan a buscar a su hogar para adquirir sus productos sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad de productos pero ella no ha logrado suplir estas exigencias. Es por ello que está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: zapatos, tintes, cremas, toallas faciales, etc. para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y así seguir ayudando a su esposo y darles lo mejor sus hijos.
texts.en: Sara is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home in their community.  She is known for being hard-working and honest.  She works selling beauty products, leaving to sell every afternoon and visiting the homes of people who always buy from her and on many occasions, she has to return home to acquire more products.  Her customers always request a variety of products, but she hasn't been able to supply all their demands.  For that reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in shoes, makeup, creams, facial towels, etc. in order to offer variety to her customers and thus continue helping her husband and giving the best to her children.

loans.use: to invest in shoes, makeup, creams, facial towels, etc.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frio, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Dedicado al cultivo de café en su caserío, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos y inversión en mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Artemio is 47 years old and lives with his spouse and his four children in a rural area in the district of Callayuc. This is a community with a cold climate, and its population works in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. 

He is making a living growing coffee in his homestead. He is experienced in this business and has a good reputation for his personality and his work in his district.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and invest in the maintenance of his farm in order to improve the product he offers to his customers. This will help him to increase his income, which will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is an excellent farmer. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1954. She is living in a district with her family. She is a widow and has five children. 

For three years she has been doing a business of planting cotton, grain crops, vegetables, etc. She also has another piece of land where she plants greens, flowers and vegetables. She likes her business and is happy to have it. Early in the morning she goes to the local market to sell her harvest. She has regular customers every day. 

She appealed to IMON asking for help to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to prevent earthworms destroying her harvest. She awaits the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to prevent earthworms destroying her harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale to earn more profit

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yancy

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Yancy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Yancy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Yancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista is 52 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teofista has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Sokny, 31, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children; two are too young while another one is in school. For the last 14 years, Sokny has been working as a farmer, growing rice and cassava to make a living. 

Sokny has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles already and she completely repaid the loans. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enabled her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house so her family has a decent house to live in

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is married and has 4 children. He has a small cattle fattening project, which is the only source of income to his family. He previously requested a 5000 EGP loan form TADE and successfully repaid it on the due dates. 

He dreams of expanding his project to guarantee better living conditions for his family. So, he requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy 2 heads of cattle.

loans.use: To buy 2 heads of cattle to provide better living conditions for his family

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham district, Rorn is 61 years old and married. She has four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice. Having been in this business for 43 years, the current business earns her about 64,000KHR per day, but she can save about 35,000KHR per day for the family’s need. 
Rorn is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to get more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gulshana

texts.en:
Gulshana is 23 years old, married, and has a child. Now she lives in the Füzuli region with her family, but  they are IDP ( internally displaced persons ) from Füzuli city. 

Her children are getting older and her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. Today she needs her second loan in the amount of 2350 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat), so that she can plan to supply her business. 

She wants to buy enough hay for cattle, vaccinate them, etc. She is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future Gulshana wants to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy hay, vaccination, etc., for cattle to increase her business; in the future she wants to give a good education to her children

loans.name: Abdel-Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel-Rahman is a 27-year-old single man from Deir Albalah City. He lives with his family in a small house. He works in the public sector. Abdel would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the necessities.

Abdel took out a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water tank and solar system for heating water. This will help him to provide hot water for the family house without using electricity.  Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and solar system for heating water at the family home

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of food to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of food to sell

loans.name: Susanie

texts.en:
Susanie is 29 years old and married with two children in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Susanie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector, 36, is a father of 2 girls; 8 years and 3 years. He was employed as a sales agent in various companies before venturing into business. He saw a gap in the hygiene products' business within his location and decided to supply hygiene and detergent products operating from his house. 

His experience as a salesman proved valuable as his business has grown extensively within a short-period. He has now managed to secure a contract to supply industrial cleaning products to companies and businesses within his area. Consequently, he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy and install display units for home cleaning products and to buy 2 barrels of industrial cleaning product; 1 barrel for a liquid used to clean oil-based machines (this will mainly be sold to the auto-mobile businesses) and 1 barrel for floors and wall surfaces(this will mainly be sold to commercial buildings and schools).

Hector hopes this loan will help him scale up to larger supplies and he intends to open more branches as the business grows.

loans.use: to buy and install display units and to buy 2 barrels of industrial cleaning products

loans.name: Sran's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Dambae province’s Kampong Cham district, Sran is aged 35 years and married with four children, three of whom are in school while another one is still small. For more several years, she and her husband have been farming cassava and planting rubber tree as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living and they can earn about 60,000KHR per day. 

Sran has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loan to make her living condition better. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her business so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava and rubber tree farmland

loans.name: Sophet's Group

texts.en:
Sophet is a 61-year-old mother of three children who earns a living through cassava growing. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her family lives in a rural area of Keo Sima, Mondolkiri province. 

Sophet is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and her business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Age 31 years, Savan is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Memot district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children; one is still in school. 

She earns a living through growing cassava and working for others for a fee to help support the family. Together, she and her husband can earn about US $12 per day from the current business and they are able to save about US $6 each day for the future.
 
This is the third loan for Savan with VisionFund. She used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan with VisionFund and she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her cassava. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her crop production to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 61-year-old married man from a village near Bethlehem city. He lives with his wife in a simple house. Naji is blind and uses a wheelchair but he works very hard to live a decent life. 

Naji opened a small grocery store using a room in his house. He sells grocery products and candy.

Naji took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy shelves and grocery products for his store. This will enable him to improve his business and expand it.

loans.use: to buy shelves and grocery products for his store.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 38 years old, married, and has children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a smoked and fresh fish business in Ghana, which she has been doing for 10 years, earning good profits.

Peace is requesting her sixth loan from ID Ghana for 1,300 GHS, which she will use to buy two cartons of smoked fish to sell. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Mondolkiri province’s Keo Sima district, Ros is now 33 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. 

Ros and her husband are farmers who grow cassava and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for three years, they are able to make daily earnings of 50,000 KHR and manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day.
 
This is the second loan for Ros with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ros wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Raziyahan

texts.ru: Разияхан, 58 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2000 году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Разияхан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 5 коров, 20 овец и земельный надел мерою 1,26 ГА, где она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Разияхан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) для закупки удобрений для обработки почвы и покупки одной коровы. Разияхан намерена свои доходы от кредита направить на приобретение дополнительного земельного надела в будущем году.
texts.en: Raziyahan is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. She grows crops and rears animals as the main source of income for her family, having started in 2000. Thanks to Raziyahan's dedication, ambition and hard work, today she has five cows, twenty sheep and a 1.26 hectare plot of land where she grows clover. The monthly income from the business is about 25,000 som (KGS). Raziyahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer to treat her land and to buy a cow. Raziyahan intends to direct her proceeds from the loan towards acquiring another plot of land within the next year.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fertilizer to treat her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for reselling by her husband

loans.name: Amany

texts.en:
Amany is 49 years old from Baniswef. She is married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a teacher and she takes care of her aging mother, after her father's death. 

A few years ago, she started a cattle fattening project with a 5000 EGP loan from TADE and now wishes to expand it to increase her income for her family. So she requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy 2 heads of cattle.

loans.use: To buy 2 heads of cattle for fattening and re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help buy more grocery products for her store to resell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos, 40, is a married man with two dependent children, ages 16 and 17. 

He earns a living by engaging in a crab--vending business. He buys and sells crabs. He has been engaged in this kind of business for four years now. Aside from that, he is also a dealer of Vita Plus health products like juice in a variety of  flavors.

Carlos is asking for a loan to buy more crabs and supplies of Vita Plus products. Thus, he will augment his income and be able to settle his obligations. He will be able to provide his children with good food and better shelter to live.

In the future, he dreams to expand his business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and supplies of Vita Plus products.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is a fisherman residing in Talibon, Bohol. He goes fishing and sells fresh fish to the locals in his place. He is a  married man with seven children. His oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 3. He has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. 

He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net, floaters and lead weights. These will help improve his ongoing catch and enable him to sell more fish. His income will slowly improve and he will be able to provide his family with nutritious meals.  

In the future, Jovito would like to expand his fishing livelihood to become productive and sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, floaters and weights.

loans.name: Ashoki Group

texts.en:
Linda, who is in her early 30s, is single and has one small child.  

She has been selling shoes for six years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Linda's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the shoes stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for its support of their group. She used the profit to take care of her child, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy up-to-date shoes and meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of buying more shoes.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, Ashok B, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date shoes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Ruvi-ann is 18 years old and is 9th of the ten children in the family. Her mother Virginia a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Ruvi-ann is studying for a bachelor of science in business administration and is currently on her 1st of this 4-year course.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 13000 to pay the tuition fees for her daughter Ruvi-ann, for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Ruvi-ann plans to find a better job to help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's advanced education fees for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

loans.name: Datkaaiym

texts.ru: Даткаайым, 22 года, замужем, есть дочь, ей 1 год. Образование у Даткаайым среднее. Уже 3 года она ведет свое хозяйство. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы. На участке мерою 0,77 Га она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства за счет покупки удобрений и семян органической кукурузы, также приобретет скот для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от бизнеса Даткаайым планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Datkaaiym is 22 years old, married, and has a 1-year-old daughter. Datkaaiym has a secondary education. She has been a farmer for three years. Today she has four cows. She grows clover on a 0.77 hectare plot of land. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 90,000 som (KGS) with the aim off further developing her farm by buying fertilizer and organic corn seeds, and also by buying livestock to increase the size of her herd. Datkaaiym plans to invest the income from the business in further increasing her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and to purchase corn seeds and fertilizer to treat her land and grow organic produce.

loans.name: Henri

texts.en:
Henri is 33 years old. He is married with two children aged 2 and 5 years, not yet old enough to go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past four years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a motorcycle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Yusuf Alhaji

texts.en:
Yusuf Alhaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Hayin Bawa Village. Yusuf Alhaji joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Yusuf Alhaji suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Yusuf Alhaji has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With an ambitious goal of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Yusuf Alhaji can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to pay for the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. 

Musarat is the motivated mother of 4 children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food, health and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in large quantities to cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in large quantities.

loans.name: Hossam

texts.en:
Hossam,33, is from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has 3 sons. He previously requested a loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on time. 

He has a cement sales project that he runs with his brothers. He wishes to expand his business and increase his income for his family to guarantee a proper education for his children. Therefore, he requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy construction materials such as gypsum and modern plaster treatment materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as gypsum and modern plaster treatment materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of beer, soda, candy, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Riyaz

texts.en:
Riyaz  is a 39-year-old married woman.  She started her business of decoration sales with the support her husband (also shown in the photo). She offers a variety of decoration items such as wall hangings, vases, artificial flowers, etc. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help her  to purchase more items of decoration such as wall hangings, vases, candles and wall mirrors to increase her sales by offering a bigger collection to her customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more items of decoration such as wall hangings, vases, candles and wall mirrors to increase her sales.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a hardworking 48-year-old woman. She is single and lives alone with one dependent child. She lives in Ghana, Accra-Teshie. 

In order to improve in life, Selina works hard. Selina joined ID-Ghana in 2010. She used her previous loans to buy groceries and sold them to successfully repay her loan. 

She receives a good income from the sale of assorted powdered milk (draped over her arms in the photo). Now she would like to increase her business to earn a bigger profit. She is requesting 1,400 GHS.

loans.use: To buy assorted powdered milk to sell to customers.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 35 years old and married.  She has been doing an animal purchase and sell business, along with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo), for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 5 children. She is very motivated to give them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Bahgat

texts.en:
Bahgat is 31 years old and from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has a baby girl. Bahgat and his wife are expecting a baby boy soon. Bahgat takes care of his aging and sick father. 

He has a ceramic tiles sales project and about 18 months ago, he prepared a place to store the ceramic tiles. A 5,000 EGP loan helps Bahgat to buy more types of tiles because the demands of his customers increase and he does not want to alienate them. 

Bahgat is very ambitious and is working really hard to attract more customers to increase his income and guarantee better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: To buy more types of tiles.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has 6 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cows. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more cows. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Mizahida

texts.en: Mizahida is 49 years old, married, and a vigorous lady. She is a mother of 4 children. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, and bread and to partition his business premises. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, and bread and to partition his business premises.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en: Afshan is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor on her street. She is doing her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling. She is a well-known beautician in her town. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn a good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran, 40 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store along with her husband (also shown in the photo). She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Sughran needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia  is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been working doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en: Rafiqan, 40 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Rafiqan needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Fariha

texts.en: Fariha is 46 years old and a married woman. She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Fariha has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en: Nageena is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Reda

texts.en:
Reda, from Baniswef, is 33 years old. He is married to a housewife and has a newborn baby boy. 

He is a laborer (part time). Since the income from this job is very small and can't cover the monthly expenses of his family, he started a small cattle fattening project. His wife helps him with the project in the day when he is at work. She uses the milk to make cheese and butter for domestic and commercial use. 

Reda requested a 4,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales and to guarantee better living conditions for his newborn son.

loans.use: to purchase a head of cattle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 7 and 16. They all go to school. 

Josephine is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 16 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With this loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested her maize. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 41 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. 

She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is aged 67 years. He is married with five children aged between 12 and 24 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past six years. Also, his wife is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children and increase his savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers of maize and pay workers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a Babban Gona farmer from Duna Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realize better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Victoria no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to top of the line farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see her increase her income considerably. This season Victoria has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Victoria  now has the opportunity to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labor.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez  is 58 years old and a married woman. She is a hardworking lady. She has been running a business of the sale and purchase of animals for many years. She tries to earn enough income for meeting her household expenses. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 45 years old. She is a married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has six children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation; now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 33 years old. She is a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and resale with the help of her husband for many years. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 43 years old. He is married and supports four children. He is a small-scale farmer earning an income of KES 8,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to set up a cow shed. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve the family's living standards. His hope is to better his life.

loans.use: to set up a cow shed.

loans.name: Katherines Paola

texts.es: Residente en un barrio del sur occidente de Barranquilla, Katherine es una joven de 26 años  cuya  incursión en la vida empresarial se dio por una necesidad personal y económica; ella deseaba estudiar una carrera universitaria pero no tenía los recursos para cubrir el costo de sus estudios  de tal manera  que le surgió la idea de  incorporarse como consultora de empresas especializadas en ofertar productos por catálogos, actividad que realiza desde hace tres años ofreciendo a vecinos, familiares y compañeros de universidad; con esta iniciativa, Katherine ha logrado cubrir los gastos de sus estudios , sin embargo desea expandir su negocio con una mayor inversión ropa, perfumes, calzado y artículos para el hogar para lo cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Como emprendedora ella tiene claro que este es solo  un paso en el camino hacia el logro de tus objetivos, que son terminar su carrera universitaria y consolidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Katherine, who is 26 years old, lives in a neighbourhood in the southwest of Baranquilla. She started out in her business life because of personal and financial need. She wanted to study for a university degree but she did not have the resources to cover the cost of her studies, so she had the idea of setting herself up as an agent for companies which specialise in selling products through catalogues. She has been doing this for three years, selling to neighbours, family members and university colleagues. Thanks to this initiative Katherine has been able to cover the cost of her studies. 

However, she wants to expand her business by investing more in clothing, perfume, footwear and items for the home, which is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. As a businesswoman she sees this clearly as simply a step on the path towards achieving her goals, which are to finish her university degree and consolidate her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, footwear and items for the home.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be self-driven. She operates a farm where she grows rice. Her business is located in a productive place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to pay for fertilizer, seeds, chemicals and farm labor costs. She hopes that in the future, she will provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, chemicals and farm labor costs

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is aged 49 years. She is married with three children aged between 7 and 13 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in a business for the past eight years. Also, her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings, to pay the school fees of her children, and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Salema

texts.en:
Salema is 36 years old and from Baniswef. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a part-time farmer, and she takes care of her aging mother and father-in-law. 

A few years ago, she started a cattle fattening project with a 5,000 EGP loan she requested from TADE and successfully repaid it on the due dates. 

Salema sells cattle along with cheese and butter in the local market. She requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more cattle to increase her sales and her monthly income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for her project.

loans.name: Krobo Bukom Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of the Krobo Bukom Group from Teshie, Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of two members who earn their living by selling cloth, material, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish. 

They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Comfort is a 54-year-old married woman and has one dependent child. In the picture, she is standing on the far left. Comfort is engaged in the selling of cloth, batik and dye. She is applying for her fifth loan with ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase more cloth, batik and dye to sell to her customers. 

On behalf of her colleague, Comfort expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva lenders throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, batik and dye to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jamine

texts.en:
Jamine is a 30-year-old young man and a father of one girl, aged 5. He lives in Johannesburg alone, but supports his unemployed young brother.

Jamine is a trained and skilled computer hardware specialist. He makes a living selling and repairing computers for his customers. He also does networking and software development.

Jamine has many customers but his working capital is low and as such customer orders are delayed as he looks for funds to buy new stock. 

He is seeking a loan to buy a stock of new computers and computer accessories to improve the delivery of customer orders.

The demand for his services is high and he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new computers and computer accessories

loans.name: Delly Azucena
