texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señorita Delly,  tiene 20 años de edad, soltera y vive en la casa de su mamá con dos hermanas.
Doña Delly es una muy  buen nieta que trata de ayudarle a su abuela con la dura carga del hogar y es para esto ella realiza los créditos, su abuela tiene una furgoneta  en la cual realiza fletes todos los días, ella sale todos los días a las 06h00 ya que lleva a estudiantes  a la escuelas y colegios, le pagan semanal, quincenal o muchas veces mensual. También algunas veces ella los feriados o fines de semanas hace fletes a otros sitios, tiene en este negocio un año y  le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para pagar el mantenimiento de la furgoneta que se encuentra dañada. Tiene en el Grupo De Crédito un año y le gusta el compañerismos que hay en el grupo y le gusta  la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos la fundación. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios de Administración  ya que está en segundo año y ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador,. It is known as the first and oldest city settled in the coastal region of Ecuador. It is making gains in the tourism field as the canton has beaches, city and countryside.

Delly live in this place. She is 20 years old, single and lives in her mother's house with her two sisters. Delly is s a good granddaughter who tries to help her grandmother with the heavy burden of the household and it is for this reason she gets the loans.

Her grandmother has a van that makes deliveries every day. She departs at 6 am every day as she takes students to schools and high school. They pay by the week, bi-weekly or many of them by the month. Also sometimes on holidays and week-ends she makes deliveries to other places. She has had this business for one year and things are going well.

This loan is to pay for maintenance on the van as it is damaged. She has been in the group for one year and she likes it for the companionship of the group and she likes the support that the loans from the Foundation provide. Her dream is to finish her studies in Administration as this is her second year and become a good professional.

loans.use: to pay maintenance on her van.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 27-year-old single man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of motorcycle transport and at the same time earns a salary that adds more income for him. He started these businesses with a hope of getting enough income. 

He has asked for a loan to finish construction of his residential house.

loans.use: to finish construction of his residential house.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. He joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Daniel will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Daniel would like to use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase fhe farmer’s yields

loans.name: Thakker

texts.en:
Thakker is a hardworking, married man with 6 children.  He is a resident of Masindi, Uganda, and operates a grinding machine as his main source of income.  He started the business to cater to the needs of his family.  

Thakker hopes to educate his children with his income, but does not have adequate capital to buy enough stock, which is affecting his returns.  He has requested a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is 47 years old and from Baniswef. She is married to a part–time farmer and they have four sons. 

Samia has a small poultry project that she started to help her husband with the family income. She requested a 4,000 EGP loan to buy more poultry such as ducks, geese and chickens to meet the demands of her customers and cover the education expenses of her youngest son, who is starting school soon.

loans.use: To buy more poultry such as ducks, geese and chickens.

loans.name: Tikondane Group

texts.en:
Eneles is married and a mother of four children, and is the sole bread winner in her family.  Eneles supports her family by selling rice to people in her community. 

Eneles would like to obtain a loan to buy additional bags of rice to sell which will help her increase her profits.

When she is making enough profit from her business, Eneles plans to build a house for her family members.  She also intends to expand her business and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 41-year-old mother of 4 boys. She has been running a daycare center for 12 years and has 4 employees who help her with the day-to-day operations at the school.
 
Paulina wants a Kiva loan to buy ceramic tiles and repair the ceilings. This will improve the look of the center.

She is very ambitious and hopes to upgrade the center into a private junior school in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles and repair the ceiling.

loans.name: Amr

texts.en:
Amr is 23 years old and is from Baniswef. He is single and lives with his parents and five brothers. Amr runs a small livestock fattening project. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from TADE.

Amr is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy two head of cattle. He will use his loan to increase his sales and allow his brothers to join him in selling cheese and butter in the local market. Amr also wants to save money for his marriage.
.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Zoila Blanca

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora, Zoila tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado hace 4 años y viven en casa propia.
Doña Zoila es una mujer muy luchadora que para tener para  los gastos del hogar se hizo cargo del bar de un colegio hace más de 20 años, ahí además de comida también vende snacks, productos elaborados, entre otros. Trabaja de Lunes a Viernes en las mañanas, desde las 09h00 hasta las 13H00 o hasta que se termine lo que preparó. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos, le ayudan en lo necesario para dar una buena atención a los clientes.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en hacer arreglos y reparaciones en el bar, también va a comprar un horno para que los alimentos estén calientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace un año y le gusta por la fraternidad que tienen y el apoyo de la fundación.  Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el bar y a  ayudarles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. It is known as the oldest, first settled city in the coastal region of Ecuador.. It is gaining ground in the tourism field as it has beaches, city and countryside.

Zoila lives in this place. She is 64 years old, married and from this relationship has four children who are adults and independent. Her husband retired four years ago and they live in their own house.

Zoila is a fighter and in order to have money for the household expenses she took over the snack bar at a secondary school more than 20 years ago. Besides selling meals she also sells snacks and processed products, amongst others. She works fro Monday to Friday in the mornings from 9 am until 1 pm or until what she has prepared runs out. She works with the help of her children, they help her with whatever is needed to provide good service for the clients.

This loan will be used to make adaptions and repairs to the bar and also to buy an oven so that the foods are hot. She has been in the communal bank for a year and she likes it because of the companionship and the support from the Foundation. Her dream is to continue working in the bar and to help her children.

loans.use: to make adaptions and repairs in the snack bar and buy an oven.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is from Danao, Plaridel, Philippines. She is 40 years old and is single. Lina has a small grocery business as her main source of income to sustain their needs with her parents. Lina has applied her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop.  

Lina is in need of additional capital to engage in barbecue selling business to earn more income. She asked financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP20,000 to purchase additional store inventory and pay for chicken and pork stocks for her business. The loan is intended to expand and improve her business. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional store inventory and pay for chicken and pork stocks for her business

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his brother and grandmother. He works as a goods distributor and uses his own car. Tigran works hard to support family's living costs. 
 
Tigran is requesting a loan to renovate his car, which is damaged. The start-up loan program, a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International, provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Tigran hopes to receive financial support and improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car to continue his business

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 32 years old and married with two children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jovy is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jovy has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gayya Village. Hauwa joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  

In the past, Hauwa suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to purchase better inputs to improve her yields. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Hauwa has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is from Vanadzor town. He got married last year and has a one-year-old child. For the past five years, Valentin has run a taxi service using his own car. He is an enthusiastic and hardworking man who does his best to support his family. 

Valentin is requesting a start-up loan for the renovation of his car. In order to continue driving his taxi, he needs to repair his car and purchase four tires. The start-up loan program, a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International, provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Valentin hopes to receive financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his car and purchase four tires

loans.name: Shuaibu

texts.en:
Shuaibu is a Babban Gona farmer from Mai Yamma Talata. Shuaibu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Shuaibu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Shuaibu would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 26-year-old single man from Baniswef who lives with his mother and older brother. Samir takes care of his sick and aging mother. He has a small business and  previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it. He requested another 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand his business and increase his sales to help his older brother with the family income and afford medication for his mother.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mapeera School

texts.en:
Patrick is the Director of Mapeera Primary School in the Urban area Hoima town with 400 students. Mapeera School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mapeera School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Patrick ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 52-year-old widow with 3 sons from Baniswef. After her husband's death, she became the family's breadwinner. The only source of income  is a small home-based grocery store. She requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a meat grinder to increase her income and guarantee better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy a meat grinder.

loans.name: Mariem

texts.en:
Mariem is 27 years old, is married, and the mother of 2 children.  She operates a beauty salon and wedding dress rental buseinss. 

Mariem requested a 4,000 EGP loan to buy more wedding dresses to attract more customers and increase her sales.  This will help her husband, who works as a laborer in Cairo, with the family income.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is a diffident woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1986 and is living in a village with her family.  She is married and has four children. She has ten years of practice doing business in agriculture. She plants onions, barley, cucumber, etc. She has 2 hectare of planting land. Her family is friendly and they support and help each other. 

In order to have a good harvest, she is planning to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals. Fertilizer and natural chemicals will help to prevent worms from destroying her harvest. She asks a 5500 TJS loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals, to prevent worms from attacking her crops of onions and cucumbers

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
From Lopez Jaena,  Agripina earns a living as a dedicated tailor. This is her only source of income in support to her husband to continuously provide for their needs. She has been producing school and office uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. Agripina has applied her membership in Paglaum MPC to gain financial assistance. 

To continue her business she applied a loan to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. Agripina hopes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Dicken

texts.en:
Dicken is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as diligent. He has operated a photography business for 20 years. His business is located in a good area and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of proper photography equipment. 

He will use 20,000 KES to buy photography equipment. His business goal is to have several business branches within 5 years. He hopes to meet the family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy photography equipment.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 44 years old and married with one child who is in school. Lani works very hard to provide for them.

Lani runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lani has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, soft-drink and other groceries. 

In the future Lani would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.en:
José Angel is a Mexican dairy farmer who lives from selling his cows' milk. He decided to purchase a biodigester in order to displace LP gas and wood, two expensive and unsustainable inputs that used to be vital for his farm's operations. By inputting his cows' manure in the biodigester, bacteria will transform it into biogas and organic fertilizer. The biogas will be directly connected to the cookstove and boiler, eliminating wood and the toxic smoke it produced, thereby allowing his wife to cook in a clean environment. 

As he treats his cows' waste, he avoids the emission of greenhouse gases in the environment and protects underground water sources, transforming his farm into an environmentally friendly place, while saving money and increasing his crops' yield in a natural way. 

With his savings, José Angel plans to expand the installations for his cows in order to have more space for the additional ones he would like to purchase.

This loan represents 20% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar owns a few cows and dedicates himself to selling their milk. He used to spend important amounts on chemical fertilizers and LP gas, while he also bought wood for his wife to cook and heat water in the house. 

By investing in a biodigester, Apolinar will produce his own biogas by treating his cows' manure, thereby displacing the fossil-fuel-based LP gas and wood. The household's energy needs will be covered by renewable energy, while Apolinar will start applying the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer on his corn field, increasing its yield in a natural way. He will not only save money and improve his productivity, but will also protect the environment as he avoids greenhouse-gas emissions produced by raw animal waste. 

As he saves money, Apolinar aims to expand his animals' corral to give them more space.

This loan represents 20% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is aged 22 years, married with two children, living in Bundibugyo Uganda. She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies on top of additional income from her cocoa garden. She started the business to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children. 

Her main challenge is limited capital to buy enough stock and seasonality changes. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs. Sylivia has requested a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Meliq

texts.en:
Meliq is 54 years old and lives in his home in Vanadzor town with his wife. He works in construction and carries out his jobs in his district and nearby communities in the Lori region. 

Meliq is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, to repair his car, and purchase tools needed for his work. His loan is very important because his current tools are in poor condition. Meliq will use his loan to provide better services to his customers. This will improve his income and quality of life for his family. 

Meliq's loan request was approved through a start-up loan program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International to provide business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He hopes to receive lender support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, repair his car, and purchase tools needed for his work

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Waziri Village. Abdullahi joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Abdullahi's farm had poor yield that affected his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Abdullahi has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

His goal is to harvest 100 bags of maize this year and ensure that his children get a post secondary school education

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is from the town of Kapan town and lives with his wife and three children.
He is has had a long career as a mechanic and auto repairman. 

Vahe, as the only worker in the family and works day and night to meet the family's living costs. He needs a loan to purchase  tools needed for his auto repair service. 

Vahe will be grateful if lenders support his business and give him an opportunity to earn more income for his children. VAhe's loan has been approved within the start up program. The start-up loan program which is the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.  It provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Vahe  hopes to receive lenders' support and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is married and has three children. He runs a livestock fattening business. A few years ago, Kamal requested and successfully repaid two loans from TADE.

Kamal is requesting a 10,000 EPG loan to buy two head of cattle. He will use his loan to expand his business and allow his wife and daughter to join him in milking the cattle and making cheese and butter. Kamal’s loan will also allow him to help his son with his marriage savings.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Yana School

texts.en:
James is the Director of Yana Primary School in the Urban area of Hoima town with 400 students. Yana School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Yana School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. James ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Vulmilia, who is in her mid 40s, is married with five children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and  a genge for five years now.  She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Vulmilia's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy fruits,  vegetables and sacks of charcoal to meet her customer's demand.  She dreams of owning a food shop.

Vumilia will share this loan with her loan group  Parachichi, which has a total of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits,  vegetables and sacks of charcoal to meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Ángela Dolores

texts.es:
ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos, dos mayores de edad e independiente y uno de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer en el municipio. Viven en casa propia. 
Doña Ángela para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios,  también de servicio a domicilio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar espejos, cepillos de pelo y una silla. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 6 meses y le gusta el trato de la promotora y los beneficios que recibe de la fundación. Su sueño es capacitarse constantemente y ser la  mejor estilista.
texts.en:
In the oldest Ecuatorian city situated in the coastal region, Portoviejo makes its earning from tourism, since this region possesses a beach, a city, and countryside. 

Ms. Ángela, 44 years old, lives in this city. She is married and has 3 children from this marriage, of which two are independent adults and one is a 15-year-old who studies in school. Her husband is a driver in the municipality. They live in their own house. 

To obtain her own income and to help her husband with the living and education expenses, Ms. Ángela set up a beauty salon in her house many years ago.  She does a diverse types of work such as hair color, haircuts and manicure among other things. She works every day from 8am to 8pm, and sometimes until later if her customers require her services. She also offers services in her customers’ homes.  

She is going to use this loan to purchase mirrors, hairbrushes and a chair. She has been in the Grupo de Crédito for 6 months and she likes the treatment from the promoter and the benefits that she receives from the foundation. Her dream is to constantly train herself to be a better stylist.

loans.use: to purchase mirrors, hair brushes and a chair

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Being an experienced dairy farmer, Apolinar knows how increasing LP gas prices and chemical fertilizers can disproportionately reduce his income. He decided to acquire a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to free himself from this financial burden and to become his own energy and fertilizer supplier. 

He can do this by inputting his cows' manure in the biodigester, where bacteria will transform it into renewable energy and nutrient-rich fertilizer. Apolinar will use the biogas to cook and heat water, displacing wood and fossil-fuel-based LP gas in the house and kitchen, while replacing the chemical fertilizer by the organic one, nourishing the soils in a sustainable manner and increasing his crops' yield. 

He looks forward to saving money, improving his productivity and living in a cleaner, more comfortable environment. As he starts saving money, he plans to improve the infrastructure on his farm to widen his cows' corral.

This loan represents 20% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 16 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 58 years old, married with six children.

Loreta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Loreta has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Loreta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario owns several cows and was looking for a solution to better manage their manure. Indeed, he used to pile it up on his farm, where it attracted flies, generated bad smells, emitted greenhouse gases and contaminated underground water sources. 

By investing in a biodigester, Hilario will be able to treat the waste and give it a productive use: producing biogas and organic fertilizer. In addition to being a waste-management solution, the biodigester will enable Hilario to stop using gas, wood and chemical fertilizers, thereby significantly reducing his operating costs and turning his farm into a cost-effective, sustainable place to work and live. 

This loan represents 20 per cent of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester (with a 16 cubic meter capacity).
